EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 汽車差點撞著小孩，就差那麼一點點。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a quick and careless act of cleaning or washing

a list as long as your arm.Headword: a list as long as your arm

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a very long list

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I've got a list as long as my arm of the things we need to do before we leave.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 離開之前我們有一長串的事情要做。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: said if you know who gave you the information being discussed but do not want to say who it was

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "How did you know he was leaving?" "Oh, let's just say a little bird told me."
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 「你怎麽知道他要走了？」「噢，反正我知道。」

a load of crap, nonsense, rubbish, etc..Headword: a load of crap, nonsense, rubbish, etc.

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: something that is not true, or something of very bad quality
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 一派胡言／一堆垃圾（等等）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Who said they were cheaper - what a load of rubbish!
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 誰說便宜來著——簡直就是一堆垃圾！

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He liked the second series and I thought it was a load of crap.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他喜歡第二輯，但我卻覺得很糟糕。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: an occasion when a problem that has been worrying you stops or is dealt with
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 卸下了思想上的重負，放下了心頭大石

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I'm so relieved that I don't have to make a speech - it's such a weight off my mind!
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 不必作演講使我舒了一口長氣——我終於放下了心頭大石！

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: If you have a long face, you look sad.
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 表情悲傷的;哭喪著臉的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "Why do you have such a long face?" "My boyfriend doesn't want to see me any more."
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 「你為甚麼哭喪著臉？」「我男朋友不理我了。」

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a lot of work to do or improvements to make
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 很長的路要走，很多工作要做

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He has a long way to go before he can present the plans to the public.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 在將該計劃公諸於衆之前，他還有很多工作要做。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a special ability to do something very well
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 魔力（可以很好完成某事的特殊能力）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The film's success will no doubt please the 46-year-old director, who was rumoured to have lost his magic touch.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這部電影的巨大成功無疑會令這位46歲的導演非常欣慰，一度傳聞他已經失去了神奇魔力。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a man who prefers to do things rather than think about and discuss them

a man's gotta do what a man's gotta do.Headword: a man's gotta do what a man's gotta do

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: said to mean that you will do whatever you have to do, even if it is difficult or dangerous
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 該做的你就要做；上天入地也要做

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a man who enjoys men's activities and being with other men
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 男人中的男人（喜愛男性活動、喜歡和男性呆在一起的男子）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Terry's what you'd call a man's man - you wouldn't find him at the ballet too many nights a week.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 特裡是人們所說的男人中的男人——我想你不可能看見他一周好幾個晚上都在看芭蕾舞。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a man/woman who says very little

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: My father was a man of few words, but when he spoke it was worth listening to.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我父親是個少言寡語的人，但他開口時，他的話是值得一聽的。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: someone who keeps their promises

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: You can trust him - he's a man of his word.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 你可以相信他——他是個信守諾言的人。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: someone who has a lot of experience of life and people, and can deal with most situations
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 閱歷豐富的人，老練的人

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: used when you think that something will happen at some point in the near future

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: If you keep on driving like that, it'll only be a matter of time before you have an accident.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 如果你老是那樣開車，遲早會出事的。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: something that you do because it will help you to achieve something else

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I didn't particularly like the job - it was just a means to an end.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我不是特別喜歡這項工作——不過是一個謀生手段罷了。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a situation when two or more people have the same opinions about something
a symbol that represents a particular thing

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The author uses disease as a metaphor for the corruption in society.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這位作家用疾病來比喻社會中的腐敗。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: In the film, the city is a metaphor for confusion and loneliness.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 在這部電影中，城市是迷惘與孤獨的象徵。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: very quickly

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Mike was very excited, talking a mile a minute.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 麥克很興奮，說話像連珠炮。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: If you can see or tell something a mile off, you notice it easily and quickly.
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 一下子，很容易（就能注意到…）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She's lying - you can tell it a mile off.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她在撒謊——一眼就能看得出來。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: someone who has a lot of knowledge

a miserable, poor, etc. excuse for sth.Headword: a miserable, poor, etc. excuse for sth

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a very bad example of something
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 拙劣的…;蹩腳的…，極糟糕的…東西

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: It was a miserable excuse for a meal.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這頓飯真是太難吃了。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a short time during which someone makes a bad decision or does something bad that they would not normally do
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 短暫的失足；短暫的犯錯

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He kept asking me to help him, and in a moment of weakness I said yes.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他不停地請求我幫他，我心一軟就答應了。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: someone, especially a new baby, who you must provide food for
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 需要養活的人（尤指新生兒）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: They've got three kids and her husband just lost his job - the last thing they need is another mouth to feed.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他們有三個孩子，丈夫又剛失業——絕不想再多養個孩子了。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: an activity that will not make you happy or successful

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She decided that freelancing was a mug's game.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她覺得自由職業是件吃力不討好的事。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a success that was almost a failure

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We caught the ferry but it was a narrow squeak.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們險些沒趕上渡船。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a very unpleasant person
something that is impossible or extremely difficult to find, especially because the area you have to search is too large
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 不可能（或極難）找到的東西；大海裡的針

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Finding the piece of paper I need in this huge pile of documents is like looking for/trying to find a needle in a haystack
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 要在這一大堆文檔裡找到我需要的那一張紙就像是（企圖）大海撈針一樣。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: said when someone new takes control of an organization and makes many changes
an occasion when you become more energetic and active than before

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: His grandchildren have given him a new lease of life.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 孫子孫女讓他重新變得充滿活力。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: an increase in the period for which something can be used or continued
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 使用壽命（或持續時間）延長

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The project suddenly got a new lease of life when the developers agreed to provide some more funding.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 開發商們同意提供更多資金，使這個企劃案重新燃起了希望。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: an evening when you go to various places and enjoy entertainment such as dancing, eating in a restaurant, or drinking in a bar
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 在外玩樂的夜晚，狂歡之夜

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Let's have/go for a night on the town to celebrate.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 讓我們狂歡一夜以示慶祝吧。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We were out for a night on the town to celebrate Dee's graduation.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 為了慶祝迪伊畢業，我們晚上外出狂歡了一夜。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a series of small reductions

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The department made a nip here and a tuck there, but they were still way over budget.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這個部門實施了一系列小幅度縮減，但他們的開支還是遠遠超出預算。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG:
→ 
plastic surgery

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I suspect she's had a nip and tuck to look like that at her age.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她這個年紀卻有著那樣的外表，我懷疑她做過整形手術。

a nod is as good as a wink.Headword: a nod is as good as a wink

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: used to say that only a slight sign is needed for you to understand clearly what is meant by something or what is happening in a situation
someone that a person has sex with, not because they want a serious relationship, but because they want to have sex with as many people as possible

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She's not prepared to be just another notch on the bedpost.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她可不想只成為別人的性伴而已。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a situation in which the most important factor is how many of a particular thing there are, especially when you disapprove of this

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: To me, business is more than just a numbers game.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 對我來說，做生意不僅僅是個數字遊戲。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: someone who collects things that they do not need
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （收藏的東西都是自己不需要的）垃圾收藏家

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: For me there could be nothing worse than living with a pack rat.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 對我來說，最討厭的事情，莫過於和一個垃圾收藏家住在一起。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: an important part of the history of a place, time, or group of people

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The signing of the peace treaty will be seen as a glorious page in our country's history.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 和平條約的簽訂將被視為我國歷史上光輝的一頁。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: someone or something that is very annoying

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: That child is a real pain in the neck.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 那個孩子真討厭。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: someone or something that is very annoying

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The kids were a real pain in the arse.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這些孩子真討厭。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the activity of dealing with many different documents in order to achieve something
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 文檔追索搜集，大量文案工作

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: To receive even the smallest amount of financial aid from a college, it's a real paper chase.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 想要獲得大學的最少量的財政補助，也都要先處理填妥數之不盡的文件。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the point at which two people or organizations separate

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The parting of the ways came after a series of disagreements between the singer and his song-writer.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 經過一連串爭執後，歌手和他的曲作者最終各奔東西。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a slightly similar appearance

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He bears more than a passing resemblance to (= he is noticeably similar to) the young Marlon Brando.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他長得頗像年輕時的馬龍‧白蘭度。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: praise

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I got a pat on the back from (= was praised by) my boss.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我得到了老闆的稱讚。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: something that is very rare and is considered very important

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Inexhaustible patience is a pearl of great price.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 無盡的耐心是難能可貴的。

a penny saved is a penny earned.Headword: a penny saved is a penny earned

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: something you say that means it is wise to save money
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 能省則省;省一文賺一文

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I'd advise anyone to put aside a proportion of their earnings - a penny saved is a penny earned.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我建議人們把收入的一部分存起來——儲蓄一文賺一文。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: involvement in something successful that someone else has started
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 參與或插手（他人成功之事）；分一杯羹

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Now research has proved that the drug is effective, everyone wants a slice of the action.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 目前研究證明這種藥的確有效，所以大家都想趁機分一杯羹。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: part of the profit or benefit from something, or part of the amount of something that is available
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 可以得到的一份（盈利或福利）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The company plans to acquire new businesses to grab a bigger piece of the pie.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 公司計畫通過兼併來分享更大的利益。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: People see others getting pay raises and they want a slice of the pie.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 人們看到別人漲工資就想自己也該得一份。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: something that you buy or accept without first seeing it or finding out if it is good
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 盲目購買（或接受）的東西

a place for everything and everything in.Headword: a place for everything and everything in its place

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: This means that the best way to stay well organized is to keep things in their correct positions.
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 物歸其所就會乾淨整潔。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a good or lucky position

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He certainly earned his place in the sun.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他確實得到了一個令人艷羨的位置。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a problem that politicians from different parties argue about and try to use in order to get an advantage for themselves
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 政治足球（各黨派政治家爭論並試圖利用以獲取好處的問題）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We don't want the immigration issue to become a political football.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們不想讓移民問題成為政治足球。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in a way that is based on known facts or on what has been seen to happen
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 從事實推斷原因，由果及因

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: This assumption will be verified a posteriori.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: N/A

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The only feasible way to do this is to study the evolution of the system a posteriori.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 唯一可行的方法是事後研究系統的演化。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: based on known facts or on what has been seen to happen
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 從事實推斷原因的，由果及因的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: This result gives an a posteriori justification of the method used.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: N/A

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: This argument is an a posteriori argument.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這個論證是後驗論證。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a bad situation

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Things have come to a pretty pass when a referee can no longer be trusted.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 當裁判不再可信時，情況就很糟糕了。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a very difficult and annoying situation
relating to an argument that suggests the probable effects of a known cause, or using general principles to suggest likely effects
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 由因及果的;由一般到具體的;演繹的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "It's freezing outside; you must be cold" is an example of a priori reasoning.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 「外面結冰了，你一定會感到很冷」是一種由因及果的推理。

a problem shared is a problem halved.Headword: a problem shared is a problem halved

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: used to say that if you tell someone about a problem, it is easier to deal with
an expression used when doubt exists about a particular thing

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: A question mark hangs over the future of the company.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 該公司的前景如何還不得而知。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: someone who is able to learn new things quickly

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He lacked foreign policy experience but was a quick study.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他缺乏外交政策方面的經驗，但學得很快。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Netrebko, who is a very quick study when it comes to languages, speaks English with no noticeable Russian accent.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 涅特列布科學習語言的速度非常快，她說英語的時候沒有明顯的俄羅斯口音。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the act of speaking to someone severely or angrily because of something they have done or failed to do
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 嚴厲的批評;厲聲的指責;憤怒的譴責

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I got a rap on the knuckles for not finishing my essay on time.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我因為沒有按時完成論文受到了嚴厲的批評。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: bad or unfair treatment

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He said that many children in the city's schools were getting/being given a raw deal by being taught in classes that were too large.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他說，城裡許多小學生在教育方面沒有得到公正的待遇，因為班級人數太多了。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the act of trying very hard to imagine something

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: It takes (quite) a reach of the imagination to believe that story.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 沒有很好的想像力真是難以相信那個說法。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a period of time when a ruler controls people in a violent and cruel way
someone very annoying or silly

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We've got a right one here, eh!
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 「我們這裡有個笨蛋，是不是！」

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: extremely colourful and bright

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Jim's rose garden is a riot of colour.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 吉姆的玫瑰園五彩繽紛。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the condition of being very old; used especially to talk about someone who has a long healthy life

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I'm sure he'll live to a ripe old age.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我肯定他會高夀的。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: My grandmother died at the ripe old age of 92.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我祖母在92歲高齡時去世。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: something that is very successful

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The party was a roaring success.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 派對開得非常成功。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: said to mean that a person who is always travelling and changing jobs has the advantage of having no responsibilities, but also has disadvantages such as having no permanent place to live
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 滾石不生苔，來去真自在（表示經常在外遊蕩或老換工作的人可以不用擔負責任，但是也居無定所）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Hal was a bit of a rolling stone before he married and settled down.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 哈爾以前生活有些漂泊不定，直到婚後才安頓下來。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a place to live

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She gave him enough money to get a roof over his head.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她給他的錢足夠他找個住處了。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a difficult time

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Government plans to cut sick pay had a rough ride in the House of Commons.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 政府削減病假工資的計劃受到了下議院的阻撓。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The construction industry is in for a rough ride this year.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 建築業今年困難重重。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a cheque (= piece of paper from someone's bank used as payment) that is not worth anything because the person does not have enough money in the bank
a strange situation or event
one of the stages or levels in something such as a process or organization, through which it is possible to rise or make progress

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I started my life on the bottom rung of the ladder in this company.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我從這間公司的最基層做起，開始了我的職業生涯。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: For her this was just the first rung on her career/professional ladder.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 對她而言這不過是她職業生涯的第一步。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Once you rise a few rungs up the ladder, life becomes easier.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 一旦你上升了幾個層次，你的日子就會好一些。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: someone who you can trust to do an important job well, without making mistakes

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Colleagues regard her as a safe pair of hands.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 同事們認為她是一個信得過的人。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a sudden stop by a vehicle that makes a long, loud, high noise that is unpleasant to hear

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Eventually, the car came to a screeching halt.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 終于，車子嘎吱嘎吱地停了下來。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The train is brought to a screeching halt by a band of outlaws.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 火車被一群不法分子緊急刹停了。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a sudden and unexpected end to something

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: My young career very nearly came to a screeching halt.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我年輕的職業生涯幾乎戛然而止。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Indiana put a screeching halt to Charlotte's five-game winning streak with a 133-96 pounding.

to leave a place, thing, or person, usually for ever

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We had to abandon the car.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們不得不棄車而去。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: By the time the rebel troops arrived, the village had already been abandoned.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 當叛軍殺到時，村民已經撤離了村莊。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: As a baby he was abandoned by his mother.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他在繈褓之中就被母親遺棄了。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We were sinking fast, and the captain gave the order to abandon ship.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們的船下沉得很快，船長下令棄船。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to stop doing an activity before you have finished it

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The game was abandoned at half-time because of the poor weather conditions.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 由於天氣狀況太差，比賽進行了一半就停止了。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: They had to abandon their attempt to climb the mountain.

in a completely uncontrolled way

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 在醫院台階上的一個箱子裡發現了一個棄嬰。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 在這個地區進行核試驗後，這座島嶼被放棄了。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: His abandonment by his mother when he was a baby affected him all his life.

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （法庭下達的禁止當事人實施某種行為的）禁止令

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The council issued a noise abatement order against the club.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 地方政務會向這家夜總會下達了噪音禁止令。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: If nothing is done within five days you can apply for a Litter Abatement Order.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 如果五天之內沒有採取任何行動，你可以申請垃圾禁止令。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a place where animals are killed for their meat
a long piece of clothing that reaches to the ground, covering the whole of the body except the head, feet, and hands, worn by some Muslim women
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （一些穆斯林婦女穿的）長及地面的衣物（遮蓋住除頭、手、腳之外的身體其他部位）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a woman who is in charge of a convent
a building where monks or nuns live or used to live. Some abbeys are now used as churches
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 大修道院;大寺院;大教堂

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Westminster Abbey
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 威斯敏斯特大教堂（西敏寺）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a man who is in charge of a monastery
to make a word or phrase shorter by using only the first letters of each word

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "Daniel" is often abbreviated to "Dan".
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: Daniel常常簡稱為Dan。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "Chief Executive Officer" is abbreviated as "CEO".
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: Chief Executive Officer（執行長）縮寫為CEO。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: shorter than usual or shorter than expected

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: They exchanged a passionate, but abbreviated, kiss.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他們交換了一個充滿激情，但又很短促的吻。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The students were given an abbreviated intelligence test.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 學生們參加了一個縮減版的智力測驗。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: (of a word or phrase) made shorter by using only the first letters of each word

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "Di" is the abbreviated form of "Diane".
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: Di是Diane的簡稱。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The bacon, lettuce and tomato sandwich is more commonly referred to by its abbreviated name, BLT.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 人們更常用BLT這個簡稱來代指培根（bacon）、生菜（lettuce）和西紅柿（tomato）三明治。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a short form of a word or phrase

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "ITV" is the abbreviation for "Independent Television".
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: ITV 是 Independent Television（獨立電視臺）的縮寫。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the alphabet

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He's learning his ABC at school.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他在學校裡學習字母。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: basic information about a subject

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: What I need is a book that contains the ABC of carpentry.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我需要一本木工入門書。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: abbreviation for American Broadcasting Company: an organization that broadcasts on television in the US
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 美國廣播公司（American Broadcasting Company的縮寫）

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: abbreviation for the Australian Broadcasting Corporation: an organization that broadcasts on radio and television in Australia and is paid for by the government
PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-CHI: 澳大利亞廣播公司（澳大利亞一家由政府出資的廣播電視公司，Australian Broadcasting Corporation的縮寫）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: If a king or queen abdicates, he or she makes a formal statement that he or she no longer wants to be king or queen.
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 遜位;退（位），讓（位），正式放棄（王位）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: King Edward VIII abdicated (the British throne) in 1936.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 英王愛德華八世在1936年退位（放棄英國王位）。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: to stop controlling or managing something that you are in charge of

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the fact of no longer controlling or managing something that you are in charge of

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The council denied that their decision represented any abdication of responsibility.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 委員會否認他們的決定是在推卸責任。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: It is difficult to imagine a more flagrant abdication of duty.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 很難想象還有比這更明目張膽逃避責任的行為。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: an occasion when a king or queen makes a formal statement that he or she no longer wants to be king or queen
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 遜位，退位，讓位，正式放棄（王位）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The romance between King Edward VIII and Wallis Simpson resulted in Edward's abdication from the throne.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 英王愛德華八世和沃利斯•辛普森之間的戀情導致愛德華退位。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: His abdication speech was broadcast on the radio.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他的退位演說在電臺上播出。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the lower part of a person's or animal's body, containing the stomach, bowels, and other organs, or the end of an insect's body
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （人或動物的）腹（部）;（昆蟲的）腹部

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in, forming, or relating to the abdomen

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: abdominal pains
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 腹痛

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: A membrane covers the abdominal cavity.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 覆蓋腹腔的一層膜。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: This exercise works your abdominal muscles.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這種練習會鍛煉你的腹肌。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: muscles in the abdomen
a Latin word meaning "of the abdomen", used in the names of abdominal muscles, for example the transverse abdominis muscle
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （拉丁語）肌肉的（用於腹部肌肉名稱中，如transversus abdominis muscle 「腹橫肌」 ）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to force someone to go somewhere with you, often using threats or violence

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The company director was abducted from his car by terrorists.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 公司董事被恐怖分子從自己的車裡劫走了。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to move a part of the body away from the central part of the body or away from another body part

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Listen for a clicking sound as the child's hips are abducted.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 聽，這個孩子的髖部外展打開時就會發出哢嗒一聲。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a person who is taken and forced to go somewhere with another person, usually with the use of threats or violence

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: These women are all mothers of missing children, thought to be abductees.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這些婦女都是失蹤兒童的母親，她們的孩子估計是被綁架了。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the act of making a person go somewhere with you, especially using threats or violence

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There has been a series of abductions of young children from schools in the area.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 該地區已經發生了一連串小學生被人從學校誘拐的案件。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He was charged with abduction.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他被指控綁架。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the movement of a part of the body away from the central part of the body or from another body part

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: hip abduction exercises
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 髖部外展運動

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a person who makes someone go somewhere with them, especially using threats or violence

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She was tortured by her abductors.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她受到了綁匪的折磨。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: It is thought that the woman might have known her abductor.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 據信，這名女子可能認識劫持她的人。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a muscle that moves a part of the body away from the middle of the body or from another body part
a city in northeastern Scotland
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 亞伯丁（蘇格蘭東北部城市）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I was working for an oil company in Aberdeen.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我當時在亞伯丁的一家石油公司工作。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a council area (= area with its own local government) in northeastern Scotland
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 亞伯丁市議會區（位於蘇格蘭東北部）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The 2016 population for Aberdeen City was 229,840.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 2016年亞伯丁市議會區內人口為229,840人。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: an area of northeastern Scotland that was a county until 1975 and is now a council area (= an area with its own local government)
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 亞伯丁郡（位於蘇格蘭東北部，1975年撤郡）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The route around the northeast coast offers the best of Aberdeenshire and Moray, with rugged cliffs, empty beaches and historic fishing villages.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 東北部海濱沿線是亞伯丁郡和摩瑞的最佳去處，有崎嶇的懸崖、空曠的海灘和歷史悠久的漁村。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a person from Aberdeen, a city in Scotland
different from what is typical or usual, especially in an unacceptable way
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 違反常規的；反常的；異常的（尤指不能接受的）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: aberrant behaviour/sexuality
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 反常行為／變態性行為

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a temporary change from the typical or usual way of behaving
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （暫時的）脫離常規；反常現象；異常行為

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: In a moment of aberration, she agreed to go with him.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她一反常態，竟然答應跟他一起去了。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I'm sorry I'm late - I had a mental aberration and forgot we had a meeting today.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 對不起，我遲到了。我一時糊塗，竟然忘了今天有會。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to help or encourage someone to do something wrong or illegal
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 教唆，唆使，慫恿；夥同…作案

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: His accountant had aided and abetted him in the fraud.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他的會計師與他合謀詐騙。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the act of helping or encouraging someone to do something wrong or illegal

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Such acts will be treated as abetment to fraud.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這種行為會被當成教唆詐騙的。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: It would be wrong to treat the offence of abetment lightly.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 對教唆行為掉以輕心是不對的。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: someone who helps or encourages another person to do something wrong or illegal

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: They are all aiders and abettors.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他們都是幫兇教唆犯。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He sounds like every other abettor of terrorism.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他聽起來跟其他恐怖主義教唆犯一個樣 。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a state of not happening or being used at present

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Hostilities between the two groups have been in abeyance since last June.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 從去年六月份以來，雙方一直處於休戰狀態。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The project is being held in abeyance until agreement is reached on funding it.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 在達成融資協議前，該企劃案被暫時擱置。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to hate a way of behaving or thinking, often because you think it is not moral

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I abhor all forms of racism.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我對任何形式的種族偏見都深惡痛絕。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a feeling of hating something or someone

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She looked at him in/with abhorrence.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她憎惡地看著他。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She has an abhorrence of change.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她憎惡變革。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: morally very bad
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 令人憎惡的;使人厭惡的;可惡的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an abhorrent crime
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 惹人憎惡的罪行

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Racism of any kind is abhorrent to me.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我對任何形式的種族偏見都深惡痛絕。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: If you can't abide someone or something, you dislike them very much.
PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-CHI: （因為厭惡而）不能忍受，無法容忍

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to live or stay somewhere

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He abided in the wilderness for forty days.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他在荒野中度過了40天。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to accept or obey an agreement, decision, or rule
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 遵守，遵循（協議、決定或規章）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Competitors must abide by the judge's decision.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 參賽者必須服從裁判的裁決。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: An abiding feeling or memory is one that you have had for a long time.

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: My abiding memory is of him in the garden.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他在花園裡的身影永遠留在我的記憶中。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in a way that continues for a long time

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: These playwrights are three of the strongest, most individual and most abidingly relevant voices in theatre.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這三位劇作家是戲劇界最強大、最個性化、最貼近現實的聲音。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Thanksgiving is one of the most abidingly popular institutions of American culture.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 感恩節是美國文化中歷史最悠久的習俗之一。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a large city in the southeastern part of Côte d'Ivoire

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The company has offices in Abidjan.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這家公司在阿比讓有辦公室。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The Abidjan airport is just a few hundred yards from the shore.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 阿比讓機場離海岸但幾百碼。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the physical or mental power or skill needed to do something
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （體力或智力方面的）能力;才能，才智

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There's no doubting her ability.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她的能力毋庸置疑。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She had the ability to explain things clearly and concisely.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她有能力簡單扼要地把事情解釋清楚。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She's a woman of considerable abilities.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她是個非常有才幹的女性。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I have children in my class of very mixed abilities (= different levels of skill or intelligence).
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我班裡孩子的能力參差不齊。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: a mixed-ability class
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 不同能力水準的學生混編的班級

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: used to form nouns from adjectives ending in "-able" to mean the quality of being the stated adjective
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （用於把以 -able 或 -ible 結尾的形容詞轉化為名詞，表示這些形容詞具有的特性）…性

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: suitability
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 適宜程度

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: vulnerability
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 脆弱性

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: relating to things in the environment that are not living
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 與生物無關的；非生物的

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: the state of being extremely unhappy, poor, unsuccessful, etc.
PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-CHI: 極其苦惱（赤貧，極度恐怖等）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: showing no pride or respect for yourself
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 卑躬屈膝的;下賤的;奴性的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an abject apology
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 低聲下氣的道歉

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He is almost abject in his respect for his boss.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他對老闆畢恭畢敬，近乎低三下四。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in an extreme or bad way
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 慘不忍睹地|糟糕至極地

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The administration had failed abjectly in its duty to protect the country.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 政府糟糕至極，完全沒有盡到保護國家的責任。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: They performed abjectly, losing all four of their matches.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他們表現得慘不忍睹，四場比賽都輸了。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in a way that shows no pride or respect for yourself

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "I let you down all the time", he said abjectly.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: “我一直讓你失望”，他可憐兮兮地說。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He abjectly pleaded illness to avoid doing the test.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他卑鄙地藉口生病以逃避測驗。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to say formally or publicly that you no longer agree with a belief or way of behaving
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 公開放棄，聲明放棄（信念、行為、活動）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He abjured his religion/his life of dissipation.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他宣佈放棄所信仰的宗教／結束放蕩的生活。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to remove body tissue surgically (= by a medical operation)

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The aim of the operation is to ablate the diseased bowel while preserving normal function.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 該手術的目的是在維持正常功能的同時切除患病腸道。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to remove surface material from a rock, a glacier (= mass of ice), etc. by the action of wind, melting, or friction
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 消融;侵蝕，（經風化而）銷蝕

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The two comets are entirely ablated before they hit the earth's surface.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這兩顆彗星在撞向地球之前就已經消融殆盡。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the loss of ice or snow from a glacier or iceberg, or the loss of rock or similar material, caused by a process such as melting or erosion
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （冰川、冰山）消融;（岩石等物質）融蝕、水蝕

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the form of a noun, pronoun, or adjective that in some languages, for example Latin, shows by whom or what something is done, or where something comes from
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （尤指拉丁文法中的）奪格，奪格結構

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: burning very strongly
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 猛烈燃燒的;烈火熊熊的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The house was ablaze, and the flames and smoke could be seen for miles around.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 房子燃起了熊熊大火，方圓幾英里都能看到烈焰和濃煙。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: brightly lit or brightly coloured
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 閃耀的;發光的;明亮的;色彩鮮艷的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The ballroom was ablaze with lights.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 舞廳裡燈火輝煌。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The field was ablaze with wild flowers.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 田野裡野花盛開，五彩繽紛。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: full of energy, interest, or emotion
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 熱烈的；興致勃勃的；充滿激情的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Her eyes were ablaze with excitement.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她激動得雙眼熠熠生輝。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: to have the necessary physical strength, mental power, skill, time, money, or opportunity to do something

POS-BODY.PHRASE: be better able to do something

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: to find it easier to do something

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: intelligent or good at what you do

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an able child/student/secretary
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 聰明的孩子／有才華的學生／能幹的秘書

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: This problem is now being looked at by some of the ablest minds/scientists in the country.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 現在國內一些最有才幹的人／科學家正在研究這個難題。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: added to verbs to form adjectives that mean able to receive the action of the stated verb
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （加在某些動詞後構成形容詞，表示可接受這些動詞所表示行為的）可…的，能…的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: breakable
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 易碎的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: washable
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 可洗的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: movable
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 可移動的

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: added to verbs to form adjectives that mean worth receiving the action of the stated verb
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （加在某些動詞後構成形容詞，表示值得接受這些動詞所表示行為的）值得…的；應…的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an admirable person
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 可欽佩的人

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an acceptable answer
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 可接受的答案

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a rank in the British navy, and some other navies, for someone who is not an officer but is more experienced than an ordinary seaman

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: My father was an able seaman on one of HM Navy ships.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我父親曾經是皇家海軍一艘艦艇上的一等水兵。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The Victoria Cross was awarded to Able Seaman William Savage.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 維多利亞十字勳章授給了一等水兵威廉 • 薩維奇。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: not having a disability (= an illness, injury, or condition that makes it difficult for someone to do some things that other people do)

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: They hold live online forums where viewers from around the world, abled and disabled, can interact.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他們召開來自世界各地健全的和不健全的觀眾都可以參與互動的實時在線論壇。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The workshops are for abled and disabled dancers.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這些研討會是為健全和不健全的舞者開的。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: unfair treatment of people because they have a disability (= an illness, injury, or condition that makes it difficult for them to do things that other people do)
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （針對殘障人士的）體能（或智能）歧視

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We acknowledge that women are oppressed not just by sexism, but by classism, homophobia, racism, ageism, ableism, etc.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們承認，女性面臨的不僅僅是性別歧視，同時還可能在階層、同性戀、種族、年齡和體智慧等各個方面遭受歧視。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: treating people unfairly because they have a disability (= an illness, injury, or condition that makes it difficult for them to do things that most other people can do)
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （針對殘障人士的）體能（或智能）歧視的，殘障歧視的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: An ableist society is one that treats non-disabled individuals as the standard of “normal living”.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 一個殘疾歧視的社會是一個把非殘疾人作為「正常生活」標準的社會。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Examples of ableist language include “crazy,” “lame,” and “dumb".
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 殘障歧視性語言的例子包括 「瘋的」、「瘸的」和 「愚蠢」等。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the act of washing yourself

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Ablution is part of some religious ceremonies.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 洗禮是一些宗教儀式的一部分。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: Your ablutions are the things you do when you wash yourself.

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: skilfully

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He performs his duties very ably.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他做起工作來得心應手。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to not allow yourself to have something, especially something you like or want
to not accept something, or to say that you do not have something
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 放棄（權利、要求等）;交出（權力等）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: to abnegate responsibility/guilt
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 不肯承擔責任/罪責

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the act of not allowing yourself to have something, especially something you like or want

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: They believe it is the duty of women to live for others in complete abnegation of themselves.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他們相信，婦女有責任完全放棄自己，為他人而活。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: It is a heart-warming tale of courage and abnegation.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這是一個關于勇氣和克制的溫暖人心的故事。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the act of not accepting something, or of saying that you do not have something

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: To ignore these issues would be a serious abnegation of responsibility.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 忽略這些問題是嚴重的瀆職。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: This abnegation of customer care really annoys me.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這種缺乏客服的情況讓我很生氣。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: different from what is usual or average, especially in a way that is bad
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 反常的；異常的；變態的（尤指不好的）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: abnormal behaviour/weather/conditions
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 反常的行為／天氣／情況

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Tests revealed some abnormal skin cells.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 檢驗結果顯示一些皮膚細胞異常。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: something abnormal, usually in the body
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （通常指身體的）反常；異常；變態；紊亂

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: genetic/congenital abnormalities
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 遺傳變異／先天畸形

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: An increasing number of tests are available for detecting foetal abnormalities.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 檢測胎兒畸形的方法越來越多。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The X-rays showed some slight abnormality.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: X光檢查顯示有輕度畸形。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in a way that is abnormal (= different from what is usual or average)

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The success rate was abnormally high.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 成功率異常的高。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: An abnormally large number of students have signed up for my course.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 異常多的學生報讀我的課程。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: an extremely offensive word for a member of the group of people who were the first people to live in Australia
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （對澳大利亞土著居民的侮辱性稱呼）土鬼，土包子

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the system that divides human blood into four main blood groups (= types of blood), known as A, B, AB, and O
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: ABO血型分類法（將人類血液劃分為A、B、AB和O四種類型的系統）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: the ABO blood group system
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: ABO血型分類系統

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: on or onto a ship, aircraft, bus, or train
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 上船（或飛機、公共汽車、火車等）;在船（或飛機、公共汽車、火車等）上

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The flight attendant welcomed us aboard.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 空服員迎候我們登機。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Welcome aboard flight BA345 to Tokyo.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 歡迎乘坐BA345航班飛往東京。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The train's about to leave. All aboard!
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 火車即將離站，請所有乘客上車！

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We spent two months aboard ship (= on the ship).
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們坐了兩個月的船。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the place where someone lives

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The defendant is of no fixed abode (= has no permanent home).
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 被告沒有固定住所。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Welcome to my humble abode!
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 歡迎光臨寒舍！

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to end an activity or custom officially

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I think bullfighting should be abolished.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我認為鬥牛應該廢止。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: National Service was abolished in the UK in 1962.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 英國的國民兵役制度於1962年廢止。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the act of ending an activity or custom officially

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He fought for abolition of the death penalty in Britain.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他爭取在英國廢除死刑。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: the abolition of slavery
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 奴隸制的廢除

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a person who supports the abolition of something
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 主張廢除…的人，廢除主義者

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: very bad or unpleasant
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 極壞的；惡劣的；可惡的；討厭的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The prisoners are forced to live in abominable conditions.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 犯人被迫生活在惡劣的環境中。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The weather's been abominable all week.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這週的天氣一直很糟糕。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG:
a 
yeti
in a very bad or unpleasant way

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He behaved abominably towards her.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他對她態度惡劣。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I was abominably ill-mannered as a child.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我小時候舉止極不禮貌。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to hate something very much

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He abominates cruelty of all kinds.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他痛恨一切殘酷的行為。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: something that you dislike and disapprove of
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 令人憎惡的事物;可惡的東西

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Cruelty to animals is an abomination.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 虐待動物是一種令人憎惡的行為。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: an Aborigine
a word for a member of one of the groups of people who were the first people to live in Australia, which was used officially in the past, but is now offensive
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 对澳大利亚土著居民的侮辱性称呼

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to cause something to stop or fail before it begins or before it is complete
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 中止;使夭折;使中途失敗

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The plan/flight had to be aborted at the last minute.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 計劃／飛行被迫在最後一刻取消。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to stop the development of a baby that has not been born, usually by having a medical operation
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （通常指透過手術）墮胎，人工流產

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Do you think it's wrong to use aborted foetuses for medical research?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 你是否認為用流產的嬰兒做醫學研究是不道德的？

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG:
another word for 
miscarry (miscarriage)
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 流產，小產（miscarry 的另一種說法）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the intentional ending of a pregnancy
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （通常指透過手術進行的）墮胎，人工流產

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She decided to have/get an abortion.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她決定接受人工流產。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Abortion is restricted in some American states.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 美國一些州禁止墮胎。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a failure

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: This project is a complete abortion.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這個企劃案徹底失敗了。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a person who performs abortions to end unwanted pregnancies, often illegally and for money
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （常指為牟利非法）為人墮胎者

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: An abortive attempt or plan has to be stopped because it has failed.
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 失敗的；夭折的；無結果的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He made two abortive attempts on the French throne.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他兩次企圖登上法國王位，結果都以失敗告終。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to exist in large numbers

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Theories abound about how the universe began.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 關於宇宙的起源有各種各樣的理論。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: If something abounds in/with other things, it has a lot of them.

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The coast here abounds with rare plants.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這裡的海岸邊生長著大量珍稀植物。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: on the subject of, or connected with

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: What's that book about?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這本書是關於甚麼的？

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: a film about the Spanish Civil War
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 一部反映西班牙內戰的電影

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We were talking/laughing about Sophie.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們正談論／笑話索菲呢。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He's always (going) on about what a great job he's got.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他總是喋喋不休地炫耀他的工作有多麼好。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I'm worried about David.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我真為大衛擔心。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I really don't know what all the fuss is about.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我真不知道這麼大驚小怪到底是怎麼回事。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I wish you'd do something about (= take action to solve the problem of) your bedroom - it's a real mess.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我希望你能收拾一下你的臥室——裡面亂七八糟。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Could you make me a coffee too while you're about it (= while you are making one for yourself)?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 你做咖啡的時候能不能給我也來一杯？

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: What didn't you like about the play?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這部劇哪些地方你不喜歡？

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There's something about her attitude that worries me.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她態度中表現出的一些問題讓我擔心。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There's something special about him (= in his character).
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他性格中有種與眾不同的東西。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "Is that your car?" "Yes, what about it?" (= Why are you asking me?)
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 「那是你的車嗎？」「是的，怎麼啦？」（有時這種說話方式帶有一種憤怒或威脅的語氣）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: positioned around a place, often without a clear purpose or order

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Their belongings were flung about the room.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他們的東西被淩亂地丟在房間裡。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in a particular place

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Do you have such a thing as a pen about you/your person? (= Do you have a pen?)
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 你身上碰巧帶筆了嗎？

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a little more or less than the stated number or amount

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: about six feet tall
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 高約六英尺

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: about two months ago
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 大約兩個月前

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "What time are you leaving work today?" "About five."
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 「你今天甚麼時候下班？」「五點左右。」

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: almost

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We're about ready to leave.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們差不多準備好要走了。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Well, I think that's about it for now (= we have almost finished what we are doing for the present).
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 好啦，我想現在已經差不多做完了。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in many different directions

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: They heard someone moving about outside.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他們聽到外面有人到處走動。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I've been running about all morning trying to find you.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我跑了一個上午到處找你。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: positioned around a place, often without a clear purpose or order

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She always leaves her clothes lying about on the floor.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她的衣服總是東一件西一件亂丟在地板上。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in or near a place

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Is John about (= somewhere near)?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 約翰在附近嗎？

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There's a lot of flu about (= many people have it) at the moment.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 目前這一帶很多人患流感。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: to be going to do something very soon

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a change of direction

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I'd only gone a little way down the street when I remembered I hadn't locked the door, so I made/did a quick about-turn.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我在街上剛走出不遠就想起自己忘了鎖門，於是馬上轉身跑回去。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a complete change of opinion or behaviour

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: This is the government's second about-turn on the issue.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這是政府在這個問題上立場第二次180度大轉變。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in or to a higher position than something else
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 在（或向）…上面；在（或向）…較高處

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There's a mirror above the sink.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 洗碗槽上方有面鏡子。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He waved the letter excitedly above his head.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他興奮地把信舉過頭頂揮舞著。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She's rented a room above a shop.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她在一家店舖的樓上租了個房間。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Her name comes above mine on the list.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 名單上她的名字列在我的前面。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The helicopter was hovering above the building.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 直升機在大樓上空盤旋。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: It's on the shelf just above your head.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 就在你頭頂上方的架子上。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: A crack had started to appear just above the light on the ceiling.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 燈具上方的天花板上已經出現了一道裂縫。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: more than an amount or level

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: It says on the box it's for children aged three and above.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 包裝盒上標明適合三歲及以上的兒童使用。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Rates of pay are above average.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 工資高於平均水準。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Temperatures rarely rise above zero in winter.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 冬季氣溫很少高於零度。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She values her job above her family.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她把工作看得比家庭重要。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: They value their freedom above (and beyond) all else.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他們把自由看得高於一切。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: most importantly
PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-CHI: 最重要的是；尤其是；首先

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in a more important or advanced position than someone else

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Sally's a grade above me.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 薩莉比我高一年級。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: too good or important for something

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: No one is above suspicion in this matter.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這件事情上沒有人可以避開嫌疑。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He's not above lying (= he sometimes lies) to protect himself.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 為了保護自己，他也不免要撒謊。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: When used in a piece of writing, "above" means higher on the page, or on a previous page.
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （同頁中）上面提到的（地）；上文（的），前文（的）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Please send the articles to the address given above.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 請把文章寄到上述位址。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The letter was sent to the above address.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 信件已寄至上述位址。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: all the people or things listed earlier
PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-CHI: 前面列出的所有人（或事物）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: more than a particular amount or level
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 高於某種程度或超出某個範圍

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We have faced costs far above and beyond what was anticipated.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們所面臨的成本遠遠超過預期。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Gifts above and beyond the $11,000 annual limit may be subject to tax.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 年度限額超過11,000美元的禮物可能需要納稅。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: If a plan or business agreement is above board, it is honest and not trying to deceive anyone.

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The deal was completely open and above board.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這筆交易完全是光明正大的。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: used to refer to things or people in a document or book that have been mentioned earlier

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: All of the above-mentioned movies won Oscars.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 上述所有的電影都獲得了奧斯卡獎。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the top/bottom half of a newspaper, that can/cannot be seen when it is folded in half and is considered a good/bad place to have an article or advertisement
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （報紙的）上／下半折（被認為是用來刊登文章或廣告的較好／較差位置）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the part of a web page that can/cannot be seen before you scroll down the page
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （網頁）不需要／需要移動卷軸可看到的部分

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: said by someone who is performing a magic trick, in order to help perform it successfully
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （施魔法時所唸的咒語）阿布拉卡達布拉

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to remove part of the surface of something by rubbing
relating to the religions, including Christianity, Islam, and Judaism, that recognize Abraham as part of their religion
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （包括基督教、伊斯蘭教和猶太教在內，承認亞伯拉罕為其宗教一部分的）阿伯拉罕諸教的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Of the three Abrahamic faiths, only Christians can depict an image of God or the prophets.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 在亞伯拉罕諸教（即基督教、伊斯蘭教和猶太教）中，只有基督教塑造了上帝和先知的形象。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the process of rubbing away the surface of something

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There seems to have been some abrasion of the surface.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 表面好像有些磨損。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a place where the surface of something, such as skin, has been rubbed away

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She had a small abrasion on her knee.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她的膝蓋擦傷了一小塊。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: rude and unfriendly

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She has a rather abrasive manner.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她的態度相當粗暴。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He can sometimes be abrasive in meetings.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他開會時有時會變得相當生硬粗暴。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: An abrasive substance is slightly rough, and often used for cleaning surfaces.
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 清潔物體表面的研磨材料

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an abrasive cleaner/powder/liquid
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 清潔用具／粉／液

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a substance used for rubbing away the surface of something, usually to clean it or make it shiny
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （通常用來擦洗或擦亮表面用的）磨料

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: You'll need a strong abrasive for cleaning this sink.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 你要用強力磨料才能把這個洗碗槽擦洗乾淨。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in a rude and unfriendly way

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "Why not?" he asked abrasively.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 「為什麼不？」他粗暴地問道。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He is often seen as abrasively sure of himself.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 人們常覺得他粗魯又自負。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a rude and unfriendly way of talking or behaving

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She is disliked by many of her staff because of her abrasiveness.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 因為她粗魯又生硬的態度，她的許多員工都不喜歡她。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: His abrasiveness intimidates many people.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他的生硬粗魯讓很多人害怕。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the quality of being slightly rough

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Tyres are chosen according to factors such as the weather and track abrasiveness.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 輪胎是根據天氣和道路磨損性等因素而選用的。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: the abrasiveness of an unshaven cheek
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 未刮胡子的臉頰的紮人感覺

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: used to say that two or more people are next to each other and moving in the same direction
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （朝同一方向）並排而行;並肩而行

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We were running/swimming two abreast.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們倆並肩跑步／游泳。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The motorcyclist came abreast of her car and shouted abuse at her.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 那個騎機車的人跟上來，與她的車並行著，對她破口大駡。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: to make sure you know all the most recent facts about a subject or situation
PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-CHI: 了解…的最新情況;跟上…的最新進展

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to make a book, play, or piece of writing shorter by removing details and information that is not important

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The book was abridged for children.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這本書刪節後供兒童閱讀。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: made shorter by having some details or less important information removed

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: the abridged edition/version of her novel
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她的小說的刪節版

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The abridged article was first published in 2010.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這篇文章的節選首次發表於2010年。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a book, play, or piece of writing that has been made shorter by removing some details or less important information

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The books are abridgments of well-known classics.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這些書是著名經典作品的節略版。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: In 1676 Bauthumley published an abridgement of Foxe's Book of Martyrs.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 1676年，鮑特姆利出版了福克斯《殉道者之書》的節選。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the act of making a book, play, or piece of writing shorter by removing some details or information

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Drastic abridgment makes this story even more difficult to understand.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 大幅度的刪節使這個故事更加難懂。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: This version of the play is marred only by some awkward abridgement.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 演出的這個版本的缺點只在于一些笨拙的刪減。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in or to a foreign country or countries

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He's currently abroad on business.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 目前他在國外出差。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We always go abroad in the summer.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們夏天總是到國外去。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: outside, or not at home

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Not a soul was abroad that morning.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 那天上午，戶外空無一人。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: used to say that ideas, feelings, and opinions are shared by many people

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There's a rumour abroad that she intends to leave the company.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 到處都在傳言說她要離開公司。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to end a law, agreement, or custom formally

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The treaty was abrogated in 1929.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 該條約於1929年廢止。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the act of formally ending a law, agreement, or custom

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He filed for bankruptcy, which permitted the abrogation of all contracts.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他申請破産，這樣可以廢除所有合同。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: This is an abrogation of the agreement, and I am very sad about it.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這是對協議的廢止，我對此感到非常難過。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the act of avoiding something that you should do

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: This is an appalling abrogation of responsibility.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這是駭人聽聞的瀆職。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She felt it would be an abrogation of her maternal duty to leave the decision about her child's fate to his doctors.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她覺得把她孩子命運的決定權交到了他的醫生的手裏會是她作為母親的失職。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: sudden and unexpected, and often unpleasant

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an abrupt change/movement
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 突變／突發情況

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Our conversation came to an abrupt end when George burst into the room.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 喬治突然衝進房間裡，我們的談話戛然而止。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The road ended in an abrupt (= sudden and very steep) slope down to the sea.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 道路沿一個險峭陡坡俯衝到海邊，就到了盡頭。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: using too few words when talking, in a way that seems rude and unfriendly

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an abrupt manner/reply
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 唐突的舉止／生硬的回答

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He is sometimes very abrupt with clients.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他有時對待客戶非常粗魯。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in a sudden, unexpected, and sometimes unpleasant way

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He stood up abruptly and went outside.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他猛地站起身，向外面走去。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The talks ended abruptly when one of the delegations walked out in protest.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 當一個代表團離場抗議時，會談突然結束了。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in a way that seems rude and unfriendly, especially by using very few words when talking

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "I don't care what you think," Audrey said abruptly.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 「我不在乎你怎麼想，」奧黛麗粗魯地說。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I know I sometimes speak and act abruptly.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我知道我有時說話和動作都很唐突。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the quality of being sudden, unexpected, and sometimes unpleasant

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: With dramatic abruptness, a decision was taken to close the school for good.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 出于一個戲劇性突然做出的決定，這個學校將永久關閉。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Despite its abruptness, his departure came as no surprise.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 盡管來得太突然，但他的離職毫不令人意外。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: behaviour that seems rude and unfriendly, especially because of using very few words when talking

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Her abruptness did not bother me.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我不介意她的魯莽。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He regretted the abruptness of his question.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他為自己突然發問感到抱歉。

→ 
abdominals

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: exercises to tone/build up your abs
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 鍛煉腹肌的運動

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: abbreviation for anti-lock braking system: a brake fitted to some road vehicles that prevents skidding (= uncontrolled sliding) by reducing the effects of stopping suddenly
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 防鎖死煞車系統（anti-lock braking system的縮寫）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a painful swollen area on or in the body that contains pus (= thick, yellow liquid)

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She had an abscess on her gum.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她牙齦有處膿腫。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a number on an X-axis that shows the coordinate of a point
the separation or falling off of part of a plant

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The flower buds and immature fruit frequently drop off; researchers have tried to determine the role growth hormones play in this abscission.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 花蕾和未成熟的果實頻頻掉落;研究人員已經試圖從生長激素方面尋找脫落原因。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to go away suddenly and secretly in order to escape from somewhere

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Two prisoners absconded last night.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 昨晚有兩個犯人逃跑了。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She absconded from boarding school with her boyfriend.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她和男友從寄宿學校逃走了。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他們卷了公司一萬英鎊後逃之夭夭。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 一名從少兒之家逃走的14歲孩子今天早上被髮現還活著。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 從開放式監獄逃走的人數量下降了。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She abseiled down the rock face.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她順著繩索爬下岩坡。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the activity of going down a very steep slope while holding on to a rope that is fastened to the top of the slope

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: outdoor activities such as abseiling, parachuting, and canoeing
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 諸如繞繩下降、降落傘和划艇等室外運動

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the fact of not being where you are usually expected to be

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她不在的時候任命了一位新經理。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She has had repeated absences from work this year.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 今年她屢次曠工。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他使大家注意到，可以證明被告有罪的確鑿證據並不存在。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 由於沒有更為合適的人選，我們決定任命康韋先生。

absence makes the heart grow fonder.Headword: absence makes the heart grow fonder

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: This means that when people we love are not with us, we love them even more.
not in the place where you are expected to be, especially at school or work
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （尤指上課或工作）缺勤的；缺席的；不在場的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: John has been absent from school/work for three days now.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 約翰到現在已經曠課／曠工三天了。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We drank a toast to absent friends.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們為沒能來的朋友舉杯祝福。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: not existing

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Any sign of remorse was completely absent from her face.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她臉上沒有一絲自責的神情。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: used to describe a person or the expression on a person's face when they are thinking about other things and are not paying attention to what is happening near them
without

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Absent a detailed plan, the project was doomed from the start.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 由於缺乏周詳的規劃，這項工程從一開始就註定要失敗。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: to not go to a place where you are expected to be, especially a school or place of work
PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-CHI: （尤指上課或工作時）缺席，缺勤，不在場

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: Someone who is absent-minded often forgets things or does not pay attention to what is happening near them because they are thinking about other things.
without paying attention to what you are doing or what is happening near you because you are thinking about other things
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 恍恍惚惚地|糊裏糊塗地|稀裏糊塗地

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She absent-mindedly left her umbrella on the bus.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她恍恍惚惚地把傘落在公共汽車上了。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He went to call his wife, only to absent-mindedly dial his boss.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他去給他妻子打電話，卻糊裏糊塗地撥了他老板的號碼。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a lack of attention to what you are doing or what is happening around you because you are thinking about other things

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: In a moment of absent-mindedness, she threw her keys in the bin.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 一時走神，她把鑰匙扔進了垃圾筒。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: It was no accident - no fit of absent-mindedness.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這絕非偶然，是心不在焉。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: someone who is not at school or work when they should be

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 因為流感肆虐，這星期有幾個學生缺課。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a system of voting in which people send their votes by post when they cannot be present at an election
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （無法到達選舉現場的人通過郵寄方式進行的）缺席投票制，郵寄式投票制

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （無法到達選舉現場的人通過郵寄方式所投的）缺席選票，郵寄式選票

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a person who rents out a house, apartment, or farm to someone, but never or almost never visits it
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （將房產等租給他人，但很少或不來看管的）在外房主，在外地主，在外業主

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a vote sent by post or by using the internet, rather than by a person physically attending an election
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （無法到達選舉現場的人通過郵寄方式所投的）缺席選票，郵寄式選票

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: With overseas absentee votes counted, he was in the lead.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: N/A

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a system of voting in which people send their votes by post or by using the internet, rather than physically attending an election
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （無法到達選舉現場的人通過郵寄方式進行的）缺席投票制，郵寄式投票制

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He asked lawmakers to facilitate an absentee vote.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: N/A

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: someone who sends their vote by post or by using the internet, rather than being physically present to vote at an election

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: His campaign courted absentee voters - the growing segment who vote by mail instead of at the polls.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他的競選活動吸引了缺席選民——越來越多的人通過郵寄而不是親臨票站來投票。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the system or action of sending votes or a vote by post or by using the internet, rather than being physically present to vote at an election
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 缺席投票：通過郵寄或互聯網投票，而不是親臨票站投票選舉

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The county plans to do away with poll voting in favour of absentee voting, saying two-thirds of voters already vote by mail anyway.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 該縣計劃取消票站投票以支持缺席投票，稱三分之二的選民反正已經通過郵件投票了。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a situation in which people are not at school or work when they should be

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The high rate of absenteeism is costing the company a lot of money.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 高曠工率使公司損失慘重。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Students with chronic absenteeism can pull down the school's performance.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 長期曠課的學生會拉低學校的表現。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: as if you are not paying attention to what is happening near you, and are thinking about other things

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He stared absently at his food.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他心不在焉地盯著自己的飯菜。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a strong alcoholic drink that is green and has a bitter taste
very great or to the largest degree possible
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 完全的；全部的；絕對的；毋庸置疑的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: a man of absolute integrity/discretion
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 剛正不阿／極度審慎的人

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I have absolute faith in her judgment.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我完全相信她的判斷。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There was no absolute proof of fraud.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 沒有確鑿的證據能證明是詐騙行為。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: used when expressing a strong opinion
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （用於強調觀點）道地的，十足的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他是個十足的白癡！

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: That's absolute rubbish!
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 那完全是一派胡言！

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 絕對的；不會更改的；獨立的；不受制於外部條件的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 你認為絕對的真理／美存在嗎？

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an absolute monarch
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 專制君主

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a situation in which one person or political party wins more than half of the total votes in an election
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （某候選人或政黨贏得超過半數選票的）絕對多數

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the highest value across a whole domain (= range) of a function
