EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 找到這種功能的絕對最高值。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the lowest value across a whole domain (= range) of a function

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Find the absolute minimum of the function.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 找到這種功能的絕對最低值。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the distance from zero of a number on a number line
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 絕對值 （即數軸上一個實數距離原點的距離）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the lowest temperature possible (-273.15°C)
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 絕對零度 （可能存在的最低溫度，即-273.15°C）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: completely

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I believed/trusted him absolutely.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我絕對相信／信任他。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: You must be absolutely silent or the birds won't appear.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 你必須絕對安靜，不然鳥兒就不會飛出來。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We've achieved absolutely nothing today.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們今天真是一事無成。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: used for adding force to a strong adjective that is not usually used with "very" or to a verb expressing strong emotion
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （用在通常不和 very 連用的形容詞前或表示強烈感情的動詞前，以加強語氣）確實地;絕對地;極其

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: It's absolutely impossible to work with all this noise.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 噪音這麼大，根本沒法工作。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The food was absolutely disgusting/delicious.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這食物實在是難以下嚥／美味無比。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I absolutely loathe/adore jazz.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我對爵士樂討厭得要死／喜歡得要命。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: used as a strong way of saying "yes"
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （表示強烈贊同） 一點不錯，完全對

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "It was an excellent film, though." "Absolutely!"
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 「不過這部電影棒極了。」「完全同意！」

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: used as a strong way of saying "no"
PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-CHI: （表示強烈反對）當然不是，絕對不行

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the act of forgiving someone, especially in the Christian religion, for something bad that they have done or thought
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （尤指基督教中的）赦罪，解罪;寬恕

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She was granted/given absolution.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她被寬恕了。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a political system in which a single ruler, group, or political party has complete power over a country
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 專制政體;專制制度;專制主義

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: (especially in religion or law) to free someone from guilt, blame, or responsibility for something
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （尤指宗教或法律上）為（某人）解罪;赦免（某人）的罪;宣告（某人）無罪;免除（某人）的責任

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The report absolved her from/of all blame for the accident.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 那份報告免除了她對那次事故的全部責任。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The priest absolved him (of all his sins).
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 神父赦免了他（所有的罪過）。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to take something in, especially gradually

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Plants absorb carbon dioxide.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 植物吸收二氧化碳。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: In cold climates, houses need to have walls that will absorb heat.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 在氣候寒冷的地方，房屋的牆壁必須能吸收熱量。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Towels absorb moisture.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 毛巾吸收水汽。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The drug is quickly absorbed into the bloodstream.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 藥物迅速被血液吸收流遍全身。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Our countryside is increasingly being absorbed by/into the large cities.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們越來越多的農村地區正被大城市蠶食掉。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to reduce the effect of a physical force, shock, or change
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 消減；緩解（衝力、震動、改變等）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The barrier absorbed the main impact of the crash.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 碰撞產生的大部分衝擊力被防撞牆吸收了。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to understand facts or ideas completely and remember them

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: It's hard to absorb so much information.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 掌握如此大量資訊非常困難。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to take up someone's attention completely
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （使）完全吸引住；（使）全神貫注於…

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The project has absorbed her for several years.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 好幾年她都全神貫注於這項工程中。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: if a business absorbs the cost of something, it pays that cost easily

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The school has absorbed most of the expenses so far, but it may have to offer fewer places next year to reduce costs.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這間學校目前能夠承擔大部分的費用，可是明年可能不得不通過減少招生降低開支。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: if one company absorbs another company, it takes control of it and they become one company

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Telecorp Holdings absorbed its Spanish subsidiary into its British headquarters.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 泰利控股將其西班牙子公司併入英國總部。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: An absorbable substance can be absorbed, especially by the body.
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 可吸收的;能被身體吸收的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Fizzy drinks provide readily absorbable sugar and lead to a rapid increase in glucose levels.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 碳酸飲料提供易被吸收的糖分，並導致血糖水平迅速升高。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Cooking makes nutrients like beta-carotene and lycopene more absorbable.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 烹煮使β-胡蘿蔔素和番茄紅素等營養物質更容易被人體吸收。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: They knew that some dangerous gases were absorbable through the skin.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他們知道一些危險氣體可以通過皮膚吸收。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: very interested in something and not paying attention to anything else
PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-CHI: 被…吸引住；專心致志於；全神貫注於

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the ability to absorb liquid
able to take liquid in through the surface and to hold it

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: absorbent paper
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 吸水紙

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: Something that is absorbing is very interesting and keeps your attention.

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I read her last novel and found it very absorbing.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我讀了她最新一本小說，覺得非常吸引人。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the process of taking something into another substance

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Some poisonous gases can enter the body by absorption through the skin.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 一些有毒氣體可以透過皮膚吸收進入體內。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: complete interest in something

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Her absorption in her work is so great that she thinks about nothing else.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她工作專心致志，心無旁騖。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the situation in which a company pays the cost of something easily

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We can justify the company's absorption of higher manufacturing costs.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們可以證明公司支付更高的製作成本是合理的。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the situation in which one company takes control of another so that they become one company

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Reports confirmed the absorption of Kode's operations into DCM's offices.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 有報導確認Kode的業務已被併入DCM公司。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: able to take liquids or other substances in through a surface and to hold them

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The compound is formed so that it can enable uptake by absorptive cells.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 形成化合物，使有吸收能力的細胞開始攝入。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: the absorptive surfaces of the small intestine
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 小腸的吸收表層

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: able to be absorbed (= taken in and held or used), for example by the skin or the body

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The small molecules of goat's milk make it highly absorptive when rubbed into the skin.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 揉入皮膚時，山羊奶的小分子使其非常容易被吸收。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: absorptive vitamins and minerals
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 可被吸收的維生素和礦物質

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the ability to take liquids or other substances in through a surface and to hold or use them, or the amount of a liquid or other substance that can be taken in like this
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （對液體等的）吸收能力;（對液體等的）吸收量

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Metal surfaces vary in smoothness, absorptive capacity, and chemical reactivity.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 金屬表面的光滑度、吸收能力和化學反應性均不盡相同。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: How do we best make use of the atmosphere's limited absorptive capacity for greenhouse gases?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們怎麼才能在溫室氣體方面最好地利用大氣層吸收能力的限度？

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the amount of something or the number of people that an area or place is able to take in and deal with

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The refugee problem is likely to get worse, partly because the absorptive capacity of the area is limited.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 難民問題很有可能惡化，部分原因是該地區的容納能力是有限的。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the ability of an organization to discover and use new ideas or technology to help its activities or business
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （某機構對新方法或科技等的）吸收能力

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The development of absorptive capacity is important in enabling firms to use research and technology generated externally.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 增強吸收能力在使公司得以利用外部研究和技術方面十分重要。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the ability of someone to understand facts or ideas completely and remember them
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （某人對事實、觀點等的）吸收能力，理解能力

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: You possess a great absorptive capacity and the power to memorize.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 你具有非常強大的理解力和記憶力。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to leave suddenly
to not do something, especially something enjoyable that you think might be bad
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 節制；戒絕（尤指不好的享樂）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He took a vow to abstain from alcohol/smoking/sex.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他發誓戒酒／戒煙／ 禁慾。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to decide not to use your vote

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: 63 members voted in favour, 39 opposed, and 15 abstained.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 63名成員投票贊成，39票反對，15票棄權。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to stay away from work

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: During a recent general strike, employees of all major trade unions abstained.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 在最近一次大型罷工期間，所有大型工會的成員都拒絕工作。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: someone who does not do something, especially something they would like to do

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: His grandfather was a lifelong abstainer who never touched a drop of alcohol.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他祖父一生都是一個滴酒不沾的禁欲者。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Animal rights should extend to geese, say French foie gras abstainers.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 動物權益(保護）應該擴展到鵝類，不吃法國鵝肝的人說。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: not doing things that give you pleasure, especially not eating good food or drinking alcohol
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （尤指對美食或飲酒）有節制的；戒絕的

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: avoiding things that give pleasure but may be bad for you, for example eating too much or drinking alcohol

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Smith celebrated abstemiously with two of his closest friends.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 史密斯不鋪張地和兩個最親近的朋友慶祝了一下。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He performed his duties assiduously and lived abstemiously.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他兢兢業業地做好本職工作，但生活得非常節製。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the fact of not voting in favour of or against someone or something

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There were high levels of abstention (from voting) in the last elections.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 上幾次選舉中都有很多人放棄了投票權。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There were ten votes in favour, six against, and three abstentions.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 10票贊成，6票反對，3票棄權。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: not doing something, such as drinking alcohol or having sex
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 節制；戒絕（如飲酒，性行為等）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Abstention from alcohol is essential while you are taking this medication.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 服用這種藥物期間，一定要戒酒。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: not doing something, such as drinking alcohol or having sex

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The best way to avoid pregnancy is total abstinence from sex.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 最有效的避孕方法是完全禁慾。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the practice of teaching people that they should not have sex outside of marriage, especially when this is taught instead of other forms of sex education such as teaching about contraception (= methods of preventing pregnancy)
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 節欲教育;禁欲教育（尤指勸人戒除婚外情，卻不提供其他內容的性教育，比如避孕）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Abstinence education teaches children and adolescents that abstaining from sexual activity is the only certain method of avoiding pregnancy and sexually transmitted infections.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 禁欲教育教導兒童和青少年，避免性行為是避孕和防止感染性病的唯一確定方法。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG:
US spelling of 
abstinence programme
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 節欲運動;禁欲運動 （abstinence programme的美式拼法）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a programme of education that teaches people that they should not have sex outside of marriage, especially when this is taught instead of other forms of sex education such as teaching about contraception (= methods of preventing pregnancy)
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 節欲運動;禁欲運動（尤指勸人戒除婚外情，卻不提供其他內容的性教育，比如避孕）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The study has been interpreted as showing that abstinence programmes are failing and that condom use should be encouraged.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 該研究被認為是證明了禁欲運動正在失敗，應該鼓勵使用安全套。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: used to describe a policy or a type of education that teaches people that they should not have sex outside of marriage, and does not teach about any other methods of preventing pregnancy or disease
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 唯節欲論的（尤指勸人戒除婚外情，卻不介紹其他避孕或防止性病的方法）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: At my former high school, abstinence-only education was required for all students.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 在我以前就讀的高中，所有學生都需要接受唯節欲論的性教育。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: used to describe a policy of telling people not to use drugs or alcohol at all, rather than trying to reduce the risk in some other way

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Their approach to treating people with substance use disorders is quite different from the traditional "abstinence-only" philosophy.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他們治療藥物濫用失常患者的方法與傳統的「唯節欲」理念截然不同。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: completely avoiding something such as alcohol or sex

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: sexually abstinent
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 禁性欲的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He has now been abstinent from alcohol for four years.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 到現在他戒酒四年了。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: existing as an idea, feeling, or quality, not as a material object
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 抽象的;純理論的;純概念的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Truth and beauty are abstract concepts.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 真和美都是抽象的概念。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: An abstract argument or discussion is general and not based on particular examples.
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （辯論或討論）抽象的；空泛的；空洞的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: This debate is becoming too abstract - let's have some hard facts!
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這場辯論變得太空洞了，拿出一些具體的事實根據來吧！

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: general ideas

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: used to refer to a type of painting, drawing, or sculpture that uses shapes, lines, and colour in a way that does not try to represent the appearance of people or things

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: abstract art
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 抽象藝術

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an abstract painter
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 抽象派畫家

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a short form of a speech, article, book, etc., giving only the most important facts or ideas

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There is a section at the end of the magazine that includes abstracts of recent articles/books.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 雜誌的最後一部分收錄了近期發表的文章／出版的書籍的摘要。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a painting that uses shapes, lines, and colour in a way that does not try to represent the appearance of people or things
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 抽象畫;抽象派藝術作品

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a noun that refers to a thing that does not exist as a material object

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "Happiness", "honesty", and "liberty" are abstract nouns.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 「幸福」、「誠實」和「自由」都是抽象名詞。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: not giving attention to what is happening around you because you are thinking about something else
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 心不在焉的；走神的；出神的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He gave her an abstracted glance, then returned to his book.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他心不在焉地瞥了她一眼，又一頭栽進他的書裡。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: without paying attention to what is happening around you because you are thinking about something else

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Paul gazed abstractedly up at the ceiling.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他心不在焉地（擡頭）看天花板。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "Mmm?" she said, abstractedly.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 「嗯？」她心不地焉地說。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the situation in which a subject is very general and not based on real situations

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She's always talking in abstractions.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她說話總是很抽象，言之無物。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in a general way and not based on particular examples

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I wanted a way to have people think about it more abstractly.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我希望讓人們用一種更抽象的方式思考這件事情。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: difficult to understand

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an abstruse philosophical essay
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 深奧的哲學文章

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: stupid and unreasonable, or silly in a humorous way
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 荒謬的，荒唐的;愚蠢的;可笑的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: What an absurd thing to say!
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這話多荒唐啊！

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Don't be so absurd! Of course I want you to come.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 別說傻話了！我當然想讓你來。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: It's an absurd situation - neither of them will talk to the other.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這情形真是讓人哭笑不得——他們誰也不理睬誰。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Do I look absurd in this hat?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我戴這頂帽子是不是很滑稽？

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: things that happen that are stupid or unreasonable

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the quality of being stupid and unreasonable, or silly in a humorous way

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Standing there naked, I was suddenly struck by the absurdity of the situation.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我赤身裸體地站在那裏，突然感到這個事情十分荒誕。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We laughed about the absurdity of the idea.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們因這個想法的荒謬而忍俊不禁。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: something that is stupid or unreasonable

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There are all sorts of absurdities in the proposal.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 提案中什麽荒謬的主意都有。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The play pokes fun at the absurdities of life.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這出戲調侃的是生活中的荒謬。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in a stupid or unreasonable way, or to an unreasonable degree

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: You're behaving absurdly.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 你的行為很荒謬。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: It was absurdly expensive.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 它貴得離譜。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: abbreviation for Association of British Travel Agents: a UK organization that protects travellers and people on holiday if a company that arranges travel fails to do something or goes out of business
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 英國旅行社協會（Association of British Travel Agents的縮寫）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the capital city of the United Arab Emirates, situated on the northern coast of the country
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 阿布達比（阿拉伯聯合大公國首都）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The San Diego Zoo signed an agreement with the Abu Dhabi government in May to create the wildlife park.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 聖地亞哥動物園五月與阿布達比政府簽署協議，建立野生動物園。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The internationally renowned WOMAD Festival came to Abu Dhabi for the first time last year.

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The problems facing immigrants are accentuations of those facing society in general.

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to agree to take something

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Do you accept credit cards?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 你們接受信用卡付帳嗎？

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She was in Mumbai to accept an award for her latest novel.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她赴孟買領取最新一部小說所獲獎項。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I offered her an apology, but she wouldn't accept it.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我向她道歉，但是她不接受。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I accept full responsibility for the failure of the plan.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我承擔這項計劃失敗的全部責任。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The new coffee machines will accept coins of any denomination.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 新型咖啡機接受任何面值的硬幣。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to say yes to an offer or invitation

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We've offered her the job, but I don't know whether she'll accept it.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們把這份工作給了她，但是我不知道她會不會接受。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I've just accepted an invitation to the opening-night party.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我剛剛接受了參加首映晚會的邀請。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I've been invited to their wedding but I haven't decided whether to accept.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他們邀請我參加婚禮，但是我還沒有決定去不去。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to consider something or someone as satisfactory

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The manuscript was accepted for publication last week.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 手稿於上週獲得認可，準備出版。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She was accepted as a full member of the society.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她被接納為該協會的正式成員。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: His fellow workers refused to accept him (= to include him as one of their group).
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他的同事不把他當作自己人。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to believe that something is true

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The police refused to accept her version of the story.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 警方不相信她的說法。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He still hasn't accepted the situation (= realized that he cannot change it).
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他仍無法接受現實。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I can't accept that there's nothing we can do.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我不相信我們無能為力了。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to be willing to believe something without proof
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 未加查核地相信;不加懷疑地相信

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the quality of being satisfactory and able to be agreed to or approved of

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There have been debates about the acceptability of genetically modified foods.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 關於能否接受轉基因食品一直存在爭論。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The correct accent can be a mark of social acceptability.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 正確的口音可以作為社會接受程度的標誌。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: satisfactory and able to be agreed to or approved of
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 令人滿意的；可以接受的；可容許的；贊同的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Clearly we need to come to an arrangement that is acceptable to both parties.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 顯然我們需要作出一個雙方都能接受的安排。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: So what is an acceptable level of radiation?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 那麼，可接受的輻射量是多少？

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: This kind of attitude is simply not acceptable.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這種態度是完全無法接受的。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: just good enough, but not very good

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Her performance was acceptable, but not stunning.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她的表演差強人意，算不上精彩。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: general agreement that something is satisfactory or right, or that someone should be included in a group

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The idea rapidly gained acceptance (= became approved of) in political circles.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這個想法很快就得到了政界的認同。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The party marked his acceptance into the community.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這次聚會意味著社團已接納他為成員。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the act of agreeing to an offer, plan, or invitation

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Her acceptance of the award was very controversial.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她接受該獎項引發了很大的爭議。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an acceptance speech
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 接受提名（或獎項）的演講

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the fact of accepting a difficult or unpleasant situation

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: His attitude to his children's behaviour is one of resigned acceptance.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他對自己孩子的行為抱著能忍則忍的態度。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: generally agreed to be satisfactory or right

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "Speed bump" now seems to be the generally accepted term for those ridges in the road that slow traffic down.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 為了使車輛放慢速度而鋪設在路上的隆起物，現在似乎有個公認的名稱，叫做「減速帶」。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: willing to allow or approve of something or someone, or to consider something as normal

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: They found the locals to be generally accepting of their religion.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他們發現當地人普遍包容他們的宗教。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I feel truly safe here. The people are very accepting and non-judgmental.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我在這裡很有安全感，這裡的人們都很寬容，沒有偏見。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: an atom or molecule that receives electrons to form a chemical substance
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 受主，受體（接受電子而組成新化學物質的原子或分子）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the method or possibility of getting near to a place or person
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 通道;途徑;（接近某地或某人的）機會（或方法）;（使用某物的）權利

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The only access to the village is by boat.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 到那個村子去的唯一方法是乘船。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The main access to (= entrance to) the building is at the side.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 大樓的主入口在側面。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The children's father was refused access to them at any time (= refused official permission to see them).
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 孩子的父親任何時候都無權探視他們。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the right or opportunity to use or look at something
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 使用或看見某物的權利或機會

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The system has been designed to give the user quick and easy access to the required information.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 系統旨在方便使用者快速地獲取所需資訊。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Hackers had/gained complete access to the company files.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 駭客入侵了公司所有的檔案。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to open a computer file (= a collection of information stored on a computer) in order to look at or change information in it
in the UK, a set of classes that people take so they can get a qualification that can be used to get into university or college

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She didn't have any formal qualifications but took an access course to get into university.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她沒有正式的學歷，但是她參加了高校入學補習班以便上大學。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a company that allows you to use the internet and use email, and gives you space on the internet to put your documents
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 網路接取提供商，網路服務供應商

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: the UK's largest internet access provider
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 英國最大的網路服務供應商

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a road leading from or to a particular place
a road leading to a main road
the fact of being able to be reached or obtained easily
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 易得到|易觸及|可訪問性

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Two new roads are being built to increase accessibility to the town centre.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 兩條新路正在修建中，以便更快更便捷地到達市中心。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The theater offers full wheelchair accessibility.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這個劇場輪椅使用無障礙。/這個劇場配有輪椅無障礙設施。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: able to be reached or easily got
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 可進入的，可接近的；可得到的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The resort is easily accessible by road, rail, and air.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這個旅遊勝地交通便利，坐汽車、火車和飛機都可以到達。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The problem with some of these drugs is that they are so very accessible.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 此類毒品的問題在於當中一些很容易獲取。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: easy to understand

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Lea Anderson is a choreographer who believes in making dance accessible.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 作為一個舞蹈編導，利•安德森認為應該使舞蹈通俗易懂。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Covent Garden has made some attempt to make opera accessible to a wider public.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 科芬園皇家歌劇院已做出一些努力，以讓更多的人來欣賞歌劇。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: used at the end of words to mean that something can be reached or obtained in a particular way or by a particular group of people

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The stadium currently has 90 wheelchair-accessible seats.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 該體育場目前有90個輪椅無障礙座位。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Computer-accessible medical records avoid paper waste and save time.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 計算機可查詢的醫療記錄避免了紙張浪費且節省了時間。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The device has two front-accessible USB ports.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 該設備有兩個前置 USB 端口。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the time when someone starts a position of authority, especially a king or queen

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: 1926 was the year of Emperor Hirohito's accession to the throne.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 1926年日本天皇裕仁即位。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the time when a country officially joins a group of countries or signs an agreement
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 正式加入（國際組織），簽署（條約）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Poland's accession to the EU
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 波蘭加入歐盟這一情況

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a muscle, nerve, or gland that increases or strengthens the effect of another muscle, nerve, or gland
to add an accessory or accessories to something
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 為…裝配附件;添加配飾於

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She was wearing a little black dress, accessorized simply with a silver necklace.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她身穿黑色小禮服，配飾簡約，一條銀項鏈而已。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: something added to a machine or to clothing that has a useful or decorative purpose
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 附件，配件，附屬品；裝飾品，配飾

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She wore a green wool suit with matching accessories (= shoes, hat, bag, etc.).
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她身著綠色羊毛套裝，全身的配飾都與之配套。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Sunglasses are much more than a fashion accessory.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 太陽鏡不僅僅是時尚的裝飾品。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Accessories for the top-of-the-range car include leather upholstery, electric windows, and a sunroof.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 頂級轎車的配置包括真皮座椅、電動窗以及活動車頂。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: someone who helps another person to commit a crime but does not take part in it

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an accessory to murder
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 謀殺案的同謀

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: someone who helps someone after that person has committed a crime, for example by hiding them from the police
PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-CHI: （隱匿或協助主犯的）事後從犯

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: someone who helps in the preparation of a crime

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: an extra electrical connection between one part of the heart and another that affects the heart's electrical system
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 副傳導路徑（一個連接心臟不同部分、影響心電系統的額外心電路徑）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: accessory pathway tachycardia
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 副傳導路徑心搏過速

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The patient has been asymptomatic after ablation of the accessory pathway.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 實施副傳導路徑燒灼術之後病人一直未出現症狀。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: used for showing that you agree with something or understand something
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （表示同意或理解某事物）啊，哈

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Accha, that's good. Go ahead!
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 啊，很好。就這樣做吧！

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: used for showing surprise or happiness

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "I managed to buy it for half the price." "Accha!"
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: N/A

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: something bad that happens that is not expected or intended and that often damages something or injures someone

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Josh had an accident and spilled water all over his work.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 喬希不小心把作業上灑得都是水。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She was injured in a car/road accident (= when one car hit another).
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她在一宗車禍／交通意外中受傷了。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: without intending to, or without being intended

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the part of a hospital where people go when they are ill or injured and need treatment quickly

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We found more than one in ten, 11 per cent, had been to accident and emergency in relation to drugs or drink.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們發現，十個中有超過一個人，也就是11%的人因為毒品或酗酒相關問題去過醫院急診部。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Many clients choose to use the accident and emergency department of their local hospital instead of going to see their own doctor.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 許多客戶選擇去當地醫院的急診部而不是去見自己的醫生。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: An accident-prone person often has accidents, usually because they are very awkward.
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （通常因為笨拙而）易出事故的;易遭意外的

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: happening by chance

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Reports suggest that eleven soldiers were killed by accidental fire from their own side.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 報導暗示11名士兵被己方炮火誤射而喪生。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The site was located after the accidental discovery of bones in a field.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 有人在田地裡意外地發現遺骨後，這個遺址才被發現。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a sign showing that there is a temporary change from the key signature (= the set of musical notes that should normally be played for a particular piece of music)
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 臨時變音記號，臨時升降號

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a bird that is found in a place where birds of its type are not usually found
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 出現在非通常棲息地的鳥

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: You may spot accidentals driven in by the stormy weather.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 你可能會觀察到一些鳥因為惡劣天氣而被迫飛到它們通常不會出現的地方。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a verdict (= an opinion stated at the end of a trial) that is given when a death was the result of an accident and not of murder or suicide
by chance or by mistake

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I accidentally knocked a glass over.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我不小心打翻了一個杯子。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: If you do something accidentally on purpose, you do it intentionally but pretend it happened by chance.
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 明明故意卻裝出無心的樣子；假裝不是故意地

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I've never liked these glasses of Peter's. I might drop them one day - accidentally on purpose.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我從來就不喜歡彼得的這副眼鏡，或許甚麼時候我會假裝無意把它給摔了。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: said after an accident in order to make it seem less bad
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （事故發生後說的安慰話）出事是難免的。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: public approval and praise

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Despite the critical acclaim, the novel did not sell well.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 雖然這本小說在評論界贏得讚譽，但並不暢銷。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Hamlet was played by Ion Caramitrou to rapturous acclaim.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 羅馬尼亞演員楊•卡拉米特魯飾演的哈姆雷特獲得好評如潮。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to give public approval and praise

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She was universally/widely/publicly acclaimed for her contribution to the discovery.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她對此發現做出的貢獻贏得了普遍／廣泛／眾口一詞的讚譽。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She is being acclaimed (= publicly recognized) as the greatest dancer of her generation.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她被讚譽為同時代最偉大的舞蹈演員。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: attracting public approval and praise

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an acclaimed artist/writer/poet
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 著名的藝術家/作家/詩人

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "Dinner Party", based on the critically acclaimed novel by Bill Davies, was made into a film last year.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 《晚宴》改編自比爾·戴維斯（Bill Davies）廣受好評的小說，于去年被拍成電影。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: public approval and praise

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: His speech was greeted with (shouts of) acclamation.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他的演講博得陣陣喝采（聲）。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG:
to 
acclimatize
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （使）適應;（使）習慣於;（使）服水土（同 acclimatize）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Apparently the zoo animals had become acclimated to the crowd noise and were no longer startled by it.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 顯然動物園中的動物已經對人群發出的噪音習以為常，不再會因此受到驚嚇。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the process of changing to suit different conditions of life, weather, etc., or the act of making someone or something do this

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Overseas drivers driving on the opposite side of the road for the first time may need a few days of acclimatization.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 海外來的司機第一次在公路另一側行駛，可能需要幾天的適應期。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Inadequate acclimatization may lead to altitude sickness above 8,000 ft.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 適應不足可能會導致在8000英尺以上時出現高原病。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to (cause to) change to suit different conditions of life, weather, etc.

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: More time will be needed for the troops and equipment to become acclimatized to desert conditions.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 軍隊和裝備需要更多的時間來適應沙漠環境。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We found it impossible to acclimatize ourselves to the new working conditions.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們發現自己無法適應新的工作環境。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The defending champion has acclimatized to the 90°F sunshine by spending the past month in Florida.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 衛冕冠軍上個月在佛羅裡達呆了整整一個月，已經適應了華氏90度的曝曬。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "Why is it that it rains all the time in England?" "Don't worry - you'll soon acclimatize."
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 「英格蘭怎麽總是在下雨？」「別擔心，你很快就會適應的。」

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: an upward slope; the fact of sloping upward

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The village was in a vale between two gentle acclivities.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這個小村莊處於兩個上行緩坡之間的山谷中。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: praise and approval

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He's been granted the ultimate accolade - his face on a postage stamp.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他獲得了最高榮譽——他的肖像被印在了郵票上。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Her approval was the highest accolade he could receive.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她的嘉許就是他所能得到的最高讚賞。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to provide with a place to live or to be stored in
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 為…提供住宿;容納;為…提供空間

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: New students may be accommodated in halls of residence.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 新生可以住在學校宿舍裡。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There wasn't enough space to accommodate the files.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 沒有足夠的空間存放這些檔案。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to give what is needed to someone
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 為…提供方便;對…予以照顧性考慮

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The new policies fail to accommodate people with disabilities.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 新政策未能滿足殘障人士的需求。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We always try to accommodate (= help) our clients with financial assistance if necessary.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 必要時，我們總是盡力為客戶提供財務上的幫助。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: to change yourself or your behaviour to suit another person or new conditions

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: (of an eye) to change the shape of the lens in order to focus (= see clearly)
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （眼睛）調節晶狀體形狀實現聚焦

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: used to describe a person who is eager or willing to help other people, for example by changing his or her plans
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 樂於助人的;與人方便的;通融的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I'm sure she'll help you - she's always very accommodating.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我相信她肯定會幫助你的——她一向樂於助人。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a place to live, work, stay, etc. in

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There's a shortage of cheap accommodation (= places to live).
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 便宜的住所供不應求。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We have first and second class accommodation (= seats) on this flight.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 本航班備有頭等和二等艙位。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: a place to live or stay, especially on holiday or for students at college
PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-CHI: （尤指度假時或供大學生使用的）住宿

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: an agreement between two groups who have different opinions on a subject, or the process of reaching an agreement like this

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She may be able to reach an accommodation with other EU members on the question of immigration.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她也許可在移民問題上與其他歐盟成員國達成協議。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: special arrangements that are made for a person or group that has different needs to others
PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-CHI: 特殊安排|特殊措施|特殊調整

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the process by which an eye is able to focus (= see clearly) by changing the shape of the lens
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （眼睛）調節晶狀體形狀實現聚焦

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a place to stay when you are travelling, especially a hotel room

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Sweepstakes winners will enjoy a week-long stay in luxury accommodations in Las Vegas.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 賭金全贏制賭博的中獎人可以在拉斯維加斯的豪華飯店裡高高興興住上一週。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: music that is played with someone who is singing or playing the main tune

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: a song with piano accompaniment
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 由鋼琴伴奏的歌曲

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We worked to the accompaniment of (= while hearing the sound of) Mr French's drill.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們工作時，弗倫奇先生打電鑽的聲音一直不絕於耳。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: something that you eat or drink with something else

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: A dry champagne makes the ideal accompaniment for/to this dish.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 吃這道菜時，一杯乾型香檳是理想的佐餐酒。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: someone who plays an instrument such as the piano or guitar while someone else sings or plays the main tune

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The singer's accompanist on the piano was Charles Harman.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 為演唱者鋼琴伴奏的是查理斯‧哈曼。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to go with someone or to be provided or exist at the same time as something
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 陪同，陪伴;伴隨，和…一起發生（或存在）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The course books are accompanied by four CDs.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這些課本配有四張光碟。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Depression is almost always accompanied by insomnia.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 憂鬱症幾乎總是和失眠分不開。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The salmon was accompanied by (= served with) a fresh green salad.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 那道鮭魚菜佐以新鮮的蔬菜沙拉。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to show someone how to get to somewhere

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Would you like me to accompany you to your room?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我送你到房間去，好嗎？

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to go with someone to a social event or to an entertainment
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 陪同，陪伴（某人參加社交或文娛活動）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "May I accompany you to the ball?" he asked her.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 「我可以陪您去參加舞會嗎？」他問她。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I have two tickets for the theatre on Saturday evening - would you like to accompany me?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 「我有兩張週六晚上的戲票，你願意陪我一起去嗎？」

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to sing or play an instrument with another musician or singer

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Miss Jessop accompanied Mr Bentley on the piano.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 傑索普小姐為本特利先生鋼琴伴奏。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: appearing or going with someone or something else
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 伴隨的，陪伴的；和…一起發生（或存在）的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Front-page stories broke the news of the star leaving, and accompanying photographs showed her getting on the plane.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 報紙頭版爆出明星離開的消息，同時配有她登機而去的照片。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Children under twelve require an accompanying parent or guardian to see this movie.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 12歲以下的兒童看這部電影必須要有父母或監護人的陪同。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a person who helps someone else to commit a crime or to do something morally wrong
to finish something successfully or to achieve something

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The students accomplished the task in less than ten minutes.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 學生不到十分鐘就完成了任務。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She accomplished such a lot during her visit.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她在訪問期間取得了豐碩的成果。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I feel as if I've accomplished nothing since I left my job.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我覺得辭掉工作以後就一直在虛度光陰。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: skilled
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 熟練的；有造詣的；有才藝的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She's a very accomplished pianist/painter/horsewoman.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她是一位很有造詣的鋼琴家／很有才華的畫家／技藝高超的騎師。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He was accomplished in all the arts.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他精通各門藝術。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: something that is successful, or that is achieved after a lot of work or effort

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Getting the two leaders to sign a peace treaty was his greatest accomplishment.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他最大的成就是促成了兩位領導人簽署和平協議。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the finishing of something

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We celebrated the successful accomplishment of our task.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們慶祝圓滿完成任務。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a skill

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Cordon bleu cookery is just one of her many accomplishments.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她多才多藝，創辦藍帶廚藝學校僅是其中之一。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: (a formal) agreement

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: On 31 May the two leaders signed a peace accord.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 5月31日兩位領導人簽署了一項和平協議。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Before 1987, the accord between the Labour government and the unions was a simple affair.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 1987年以前，工黨政府和工會之間很容易達成一致。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The project is completely in accord with government policy.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 該企劃案完全符合政府政策。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: If you do something of your own accord, you do it without being asked to do it.
If people do something with one accord, they do it together and in complete agreement.

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to treat someone specially, usually by showing respect
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （通常指恭敬地）給予（特殊待遇）;授予

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The massed crowds of supporters accorded him a hero's welcome.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 蜂擁雲集的支持者給予他英雄般的歡迎。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Certainly in our society teachers don't enjoy the respect that is accorded to doctors and lawyers.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 的確，在我們這個社會中，老師沒有得到像醫生和律師所受到的那種尊敬。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to be the same as something, or to agree with something

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: His version of events does not accord with witnesses' statements.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他對事件的說法和目擊者的陳述不一致。

POS-BODY.PHRASE: in accordance with a rule, law, wish, etc.

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: following or obeying a rule, law, wish, etc.

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: as stated by

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: According to Sarah they're not getting on very well at the moment.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 據薩拉說，他們目前關係不是太好。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: According to our records you owe us $130.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 根據我們的紀錄，你欠我們130美元。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in a way that agrees with

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Students are all put in different groups according to their ability.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 所有的學生都按能力進行分組。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: Something that happens according to plan happens in the way it was intended to.
PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-CHI: 按部就班;按照計劃進行

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in a way that is suitable or right for the situation

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: When we receive your instructions we will act accordingly.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們接到你的指示就會遵命行事。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She's an expert in her field, and is paid accordingly.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她是這個領域的專家，且得到了相對的報酬。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a box-shaped musical instrument consisting of a folded central part with a keyboard, played by pushing the two ends towards each other
to go up to or stop and speak to someone in a threatening way
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （貿然）上前搭訕;（唐突地）走近談話

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I'm usually accosted by beggars and drunks as I walk to the station.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 去車站的路上，經常有乞丐和酒鬼上前跟我搭訕。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: an arrangement with a bank to keep your money there and to allow you to take it out when you need to

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I've opened an account with a building society.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我在房屋互助協會開了個帳戶。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I paid the money into my account this morning.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 今天上午我把錢存入了我的帳戶。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She paid the cheque into her account.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她把支票存入了帳戶。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She deposited the check in her account.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她把支票存入了帳戶。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I need to draw some money out of my account.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我需要從我的帳戶裡取出一些錢來。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a written or spoken description of an event

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She gave a thrilling account of her life in the jungle.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她把自己在叢林中生活的經歷描述得驚險刺激。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He kept a detailed account of the suspect's movements.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他詳細紀錄了犯罪嫌疑人的一舉一動。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Several eyewitnesses' accounts differed considerably from the official version of events.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 幾個目擊者對於事件的敘述和官方的說法有很大出入。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: as said by most people
PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-CHI: 根據各方面所說;據說;大家都說

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: If something is true by your own account, what you say is true although you have not proved it.
because of something

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: an agreement with a shop or business that allows you to buy things and pay for them later

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Could you put it on/charge it to my account (= can I pay for it later), please?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 把這筆錢記在我的（賒購）帳上好嗎？

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Do you have an account at this store/with us, madam?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 女士，你在我們商店有賒購帳戶嗎？

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Could you please pay/settle your account in full (= give us all the money you owe us)?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 您可以把賒的帳全結清嗎？

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a customer who does business with a company

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: If the advertising agency loses this account, it will make a big dent in their profits.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 如果該廣告公司丟掉了這個客戶，他們的利潤就會銳減。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: to not be important

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to think of someone or something in the stated way

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She was accounted a genius by all who knew her work.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 所有知道她作品的人都認為她是個天才。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to explain the reason for something or the cause of something
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （對某人）就…作出解釋;（對某人）就…作出說明

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Can you account for your absence last Friday?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 你能解釋一下上週五你為甚麼缺勤嗎？

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She was unable to account for over $5,000 (= she could not explain where the money was).
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她無法對5000多美元的去向作出解釋。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He has to account to his manager for (= tell his manager about and explain) all his movements.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他不得不向經理交代清楚他的一切行動。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to form the total of something

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Students account for the vast majority of our customers.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們的顧客絕大多數是學生。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the fact of being responsible for what you do and able to give a satisfactory reason for it, or the degree to which this happens

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There were furious demands for greater police accountability.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 人們強烈要求加強對警察的問責。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Accountability is important these days, and managers aren't always willing to adopt risky strategies.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 如今，問責很重要，管理者並不總是願意採高風險的策略。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: Someone who is accountable is completely responsible for what they do and must be able to give a satisfactory reason for it.
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 應負責任的；應作解釋的；應加以說明的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She is accountable only to the managing director.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她只對總裁負責。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The recent tax reforms have made government more accountable for its spending.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 最近的稅務改革使政府的開支更加透明化。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Politicians should be accountable to the public who elected them.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 政界人士應對他們的選民負責。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the job of being an accountant

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He works in accountancy.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他的職業是會計。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an accountancy firm
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 會計師事務所

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: someone who keeps or examines the records of money received, paid, and owed by a company or person

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: a firm of accountants
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 會計師事務所

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the skill or activity of keeping records of the money a person or organization earns and spends
the job of being an accountant
an official record of all the money a person or company has spent and received

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I keep my own accounts.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我的帳自己記。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the equipment needed for a particular activity or way of life
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （某種活動或生活方式所需的）裝備;配備

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the capital city of Ghana, in the southern part of the country

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He wrote, directed and produced a video about life in Accra, his hometown.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他編劇、導演和制作了一部關於他的家鄉——阿克拉生活的電影。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: William took the children to visit his sister and her family in Anyaa, a suburb on the outskirts of Accra.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 威廉帶著孩子們去拜訪了他在阿克拉城郊阿尼亞的姐姐和她的家人。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to officially recognize, accept, or approve of someone or something
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 鑒定…為合格;認可;認為…屬實;授權

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The agency was not accredited by the Philippine Consulate to offer contracts to Filipinos abroad.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 該代理機構沒有得到菲律賓領事館的批准，無權向國外的菲律賓人提供承包合約。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the fact of being officially recognized, accepted, or approved of, or the act of officially recognizing, accepting, or approving of something

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The college was given full accreditation in 1965.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 該學院於1965年獲得完全的官方認證。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The committee has established new procedures for the accreditation of degrees.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 委員會制定了新的學位認證程序。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: officially recognized or approved
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 官方認可的;獲正式承認的;鑒定合格的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an accredited drama school
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 經鑒定合格的戲劇學校

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: accredited war correspondents
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 特派戰地記者

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to gradually increase or grow by the addition of new layers or parts, or to cause something to do this

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Eventually, the material accretes by gravity to form separate planets.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 最終，透過重力吸積的物質形成了獨立的星球。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Scientists drilled more than two miles into the accreted ice above the lake.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 科學家在湖面堆積形成的冰層上往下鑽探了兩英里。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a gradual increase or growth by the addition of new layers or parts
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 堆積，積聚；逐漸的增加，增大

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The fund was increased by the accretion of new shareholders.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 由於新股東的逐漸加入，資金增加了。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The room hadn't been cleaned for years and showed several accretions of dirt and dust.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 房間多年沒有打掃，積了厚厚的灰塵。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a gradual increase in an amount of money
to increase in number or amount over a period of time

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Interest will accrue on the account at a rate of seven percent.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 帳戶上的存款將會以7%的利率生息。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Little benefit will accrue to the city (= it will receive little benefit) from the new transport links.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 新的道路修建計劃幾乎不會給該城市帶來甚麼利益。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to change so that you become more like people from a different culture, or to make someone change in this way
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （使）適應新的文化習俗;（使）受同化

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: How did Hispanics acculturate to life in America?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 拉美人是如何適應美國的生活的？

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the process of changing so that you become more like people from a different culture, or of making someone change in this way
to collect a large number of things over a long period of time

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: As people accumulate more wealth, they tend to spend a greater proportion of their incomes.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 人們積累了更多財富後，他們的花費佔收入的比重也往往會增加。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The company said the debt was accumulated during its acquisition of nine individual businesses.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 該公司稱其在收購九家個體公司的過程中，債務越積越多。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We've accumulated so much rubbish over the years.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 多年來我們已經堆積了這麼多的垃圾。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to gradually increase in number or amount

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: A thick layer of dust had accumulated in the room.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 房間裡積了厚厚一層灰塵。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: If you don't go through the papers on your desk on a regular basis, they just keep on accumulating.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 如果你不去定期整理辦公桌上的文檔，它們就會越積越多。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: an amount of something that has been collected

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Despite this accumulation of evidence, the government persisted in doing nothing.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 儘管種種跡象不斷出現，政府仍然堅持不採取任何行動。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Accumulations of sand can be formed by the action of waves on coastal beaches.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 由於海浪的衝擊作用，海灘上會堆積沙子。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: gradually increasing in number or amount

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: the accumulative effect of many infections
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 多次傳染積累下來的後果

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a battery that collects and stores electricity
the fact of being exact or correct
