EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Ellis Pike was chosen to act the part of the lawyer in the film.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 艾理斯‧派克被選中在影片中扮演律師這個角色。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Have you ever acted in a play before?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 你以前演過戲劇嗎？

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: to behave in a particular, usually bad, way
PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-CHI: （通常指裝腔作勢地）裝傻（作出一副假聖人的樣子等）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: something that you do

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an act of aggression/bravery/madness/terrorism
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 侵略行為／英勇行為／瘋狂的舉動／恐怖主義行徑

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: a kind/thoughtless/selfish act
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 善舉／輕率的舉動／自私的行為

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The simple act of telling someone about a problem can help.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 就算是僅僅將問題對他人傾吐也會對自己起到幫助。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Primitive people regarded storms as an act of God.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 原始人認為風暴是神的所為。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: artistic representations of the sexual act
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 性行為的藝術體現

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: behaviour that hides your real feelings or intentions
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 裝模作樣;裝腔作勢;假裝

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Was she really upset or was that just an act?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她是真的難過還是只裝裝樣子？

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a person or group that performs a short piece in a show, or the piece that they perform.
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 表演者（或表演組合）;一段表演

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: a comedy/juggling/trapeze act
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 一段喜劇／雜耍／高空鞦韆表演節目

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Our next act is a very talented young musician.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 表演下一個節目的是一位元元元元才華橫溢的年輕音樂家。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a part of a play or opera

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Shakespeare's plays were written in five acts.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 莎士比亞的戲劇是按五幕劇格式創作的。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The hero does not enter until the second act/Act Two.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 男主角直到第二幕才出場。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a law or formal decision made by a parliament or other group of people who make the laws for their country

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an Act of Parliament
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 議會法案

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: the Betting and Gaming Act
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 《賭博法》

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Almost two hundred suspects were detained in the UK last year under the Prevention of Terrorism Act.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 根據《防止恐怖主義法》，去年英國有將近200名嫌疑犯被拘留。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The state legislature passed an act banning the sale of automatic weapons.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 州議會通過了一項禁止銷售自動武器的法令。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to do a particular job, especially one that you do not normally do

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He was asked to act as an adviser on the project.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他被請去擔任那個企劃案的顧問。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to have a particular effect

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Some people say that capital punishment acts as a deterrent.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 一些人認為死刑有威懾作用。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to do a particular job, especially one that you do not normally do

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He was asked to act as an adviser on the project.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他被請去擔任那個企劃案的顧問。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to have a particular effect

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Some people say that capital punishment acts as a deterrent.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 一些人認為死刑有威懾作用。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to behave badly because you are unhappy or upset, often in ways that you are not aware of
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （因為不滿或痛苦而）發洩或行為不當

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: These kids act out because their lives are a mess.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這些孩子行為不當是因為他們的生活一團糟。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to perform the actions and say the words of a situation or story

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The children acted out their favourite poem.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 孩子把他們最喜愛的詩歌表演出來。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to express your thoughts, emotions, or ideas in your actions
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 用行動來表現（想法、感情等）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Children's negative feelings often get acted out in bad behaviour.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 兒童的消極情緒常會透過不良行為表現出來。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: If a person, especially a child, acts up, they behave badly.

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Sophie got bored and started acting up.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 索菲心中感到煩悶，就開始調皮搗蛋起來。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: If a machine or part of the body acts up, it does not perform as well as it should.
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （機器）運轉不正常；（身體部位）出毛病

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: My car always acts up in cold weather.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 天冷時，我的車老出故障。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Her shoulder was acting up (= hurting because of injury).
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她的肩傷發作。

act/do sth on your own responsibility.Headword: act/do sth on your own responsibility

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to act without being told to by someone in authority
to behave in a silly way

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Stop acting the goat!
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 別再做蠢事了！

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the job of performing in films or plays

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He wants to get into acting.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他想從事演藝工作。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: someone who does a job for a short time while the person who usually does that job is not there

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a chemical element that is a soft, silver-white metal and is radioactive

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Researchers are testing the actinium.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 研究者正在測試錒。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the process of doing something, especially when dealing with a problem or difficulty
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （尤指應對問題或困難的）行動；行動過程；行為

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: This problem calls for swift/prompt action from the government.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這個問題需要政府馬上採取行動。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Action to prevent the spread of the disease is high on the government's agenda.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 採取行動防止疾病蔓延是政府的當務之急。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We must take action (= do something) to deal with the problem before it spreads to other areas.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 在這個問題蔓延到其他地區之前我們一定要採取行動將其解決。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: So what's the plan of action? (= What are we going to do?)
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 那麼行動計劃是甚麼？

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The complaints system swings into action (= starts to work) as soon as a claim is made.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 一旦有人提出索賠，投訴處理系統就馬上啟動。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The committee was spurred into action (= encouraged to do something) by the threat of government cuts.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 政府威脅要削減經費，這促使委員會採取了行動。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: something that you do

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She has to accept the consequences of her actions.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她必須對自己行為的後果負責。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I asked him to explain his actions.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我要求他為自己的所作所為作出解釋。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a physical movement

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I'll say the words and you can mime the actions.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我會說出這些詞，你可以做動作把它們的意思表達出來。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: It only needs a small wrist action (= movement of the wrist) to start the process.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 只需動一動手腕，程序就啟動了。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: things that are happening, especially exciting or important things
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 發生的事情；（尤指）令人激動的事或大事

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I like movies with a lot of action.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我喜歡情節緊湊的影片。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: In her last novel, the action (= the main events) moves between Greece and southern Spain.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 在她最近發表的那本小說裡，故事情節在希臘和西班牙南部交替展開。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: at the place where something important or interesting is happening
PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-CHI: 大事（或趣事）發生的地方

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the effect something has on another thing

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: They recorded the action of the drug on the nervous system.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他們紀錄下了這種藥物對神經系統的作用。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: fighting in a war

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Her younger son was killed in action.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她的小兒子在戰鬥中陣亡。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He was reported missing in action.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 報告稱他在戰鬥中失蹤了。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He saw action (= fought as a soldier) in the trenches.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他參加了壕溝戰。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the way something moves or works

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We studied the action of the digestive system.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們研究了消化系統的機能。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The car has a very smooth braking action.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這輛轎車煞車性能很平穩。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a legal process that is decided in a law court

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: a libel action
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 誹謗訴訟

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She brought an action (for negligence) against the hospital.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她起訴醫院（怠忽職守）。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: A criminal action was brought against him.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他被提起刑事訴訟。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The book was halted in South Africa by a threat of legal action.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 因為遭到起訴的威脅，該書在南非停止發行。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to do something to deal with a particular problem or matter
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 對…採取行動；就…採取措施

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I'll just run through the minutes of the last meeting, raising those points that still have to be actioned.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 下面我將扼要重述一下上次會議的紀錄，把亟待處理的問題提出來。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a toy that is made to look like a soldier or a character from a film or television show
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 玩具兵（以卡通，電影人物為原型的人偶）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the hero (= the main character, who is usually good) of a film, television programme, or sometimes a book, who experiences and does a lot of exciting and often violent things, such as fighting against bad people or dangerous creatures

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Arnold Schwarzenegger has played some of the greatest action heroes of all time.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 阿諾德·施瓦辛格扮演過一些有史以來最偉大的動作片英雄。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a type of film in which a lot of exciting things happen

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He loves action movies - all car chases and jumping out of planes.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他很喜歡看動作片——飆車追逐、跳飛機等等。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: People often don't think of "Saving Private Ryan" as an action film.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 一般來說，人們並不把《搶救雷恩大兵》看作是一部動作片。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a repeat of an important moment from a sports event shown on television, often more slowly to show the action in detail
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （電視中體育比賽精彩瞬間的）即時重放，慢鏡頭重播

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: They showed an action replay of the goal.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他們用慢鏡頭重播了進球的精彩瞬間。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the situation in which you are as ready as possible to perform a task you have been preparing for

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The whole school was at action stations for the inspectors' visit.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 全校都做好了準備迎接督察的到來。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: used to tell people to get ready immediately to do the particular jobs that they have been given to do
PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-CHI: （用來命令做好準備）各就各位！

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: full of exciting events
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 精彩紛呈的;令人感到緊張刺激的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an action-packed thriller/weekend/finale
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 情節緊張刺激的驚險小說／活動精彩紛呈的週末／高潮迭起的結尾

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: If something is actionable, it gives someone a good reason for accusing someone in a law court.
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 可起訴的，可以提起訴訟的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She denies that her company has been involved in any actionable activity.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她否認其公司捲入了任何可被起訴的活動。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a type of film in which a lot of exciting things happen

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Wahlberg plays a former Marine sniper in the actioner "Shooter".
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 沃爾伯格在動作片《生死狙擊》中扮演了一名前海軍狙擊手。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: This race-against-time actioner has had mixed reviews.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這部與時間賽跑的動作片毀譽參半。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: said to emphasize that what you do is more important and shows your intentions and feelings more clearly than what you say
to cause something to start

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The alarm is activated by the lightest pressure.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 最輕微的壓力也會觸動警報器。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to make a chemical reaction happen more quickly, especially by heating
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （尤指透過加熱）加速…的化學反應

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the act of making something start or making it start working

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The false activation of an alarm is a serious matter.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 誤觸警報是很嚴重的事。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: You will be sent an account activation email.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 你會收到一封帳戶激活郵件。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: busy with a particular activity

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: physically/mentally active
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 經常運動的／思想活躍的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: You have to try to keep active as you grow older.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 年紀大了，應該盡量保持身心活躍。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: involved in a particular activity

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Enemy forces remain active in the mountainous areas around the city.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 敵軍在城市周圍的山區仍然活動猖獗。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She's very active in (= involved in) local politics.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她積極參與當地的政治活動。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Both of his parents were very politically active.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他的父母在政治上都很積極。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: It is important to educate children before they become sexually active.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 在孩子進入性活躍期之前對他們進行有關教育很重要。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He takes a more active role in the team nowadays.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 現在他在隊裡發揮著更為積極的作用。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She's an active member of her trade union (= not only belongs to it, but does work to help it).
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她是工會中的活躍分子。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: An active volcano is one that might erupt (= throw out hot liquid rock or other matter) at any time.
An active verb or sentence is one in which the subject is the person or thing that performs the stated action.

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "Catrin told me" is an active sentence, and "I was told by Catrin" is passive.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: Catrin told me 是主動句，而 I was told by Catrin 是被動句。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG:
→ 
the active voice
PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-CHI: 主動語態（同 the active voice）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the situation in which the body produces its own antibodies (= substances in the blood that fight disease)
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （身體的）自動免疫（性），主動免疫（性）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a way of treating a medical condition that involves a period of waiting and regular testing, rather than immediate treatment such as surgery or chemotherapy
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （醫療方面的）主動監測，積極監測，積極監察

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in a way that involves positive action

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He's very actively involved in (= does a lot of work for) the local party.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他積極參與地方政黨事務。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: It's nice having a man who actively encourages me to spend money.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 有這樣一個起勁地鼓勵我花錢的男人真是不錯。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I've been actively looking for a job for six months.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 半年來，我一直在積極地找工作。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: clothes that are worn for sports or other physical activities

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Women's activewear is becoming an important sector of the fashion industry.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 女式運動裝正發展成為時裝界的一個重要領域。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the use of direct and noticeable action to achieve a result, usually a political or social one
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （通常指為達到政治或社會目的而採取各種手段的）激進主義，行動主義

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: black/student activism
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 黑人／學生運動激進主義

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The levels of political activism in this country have greatly declined.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 該國工會和政治激進主義的活動勢力已大大減弱。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a person who believes strongly in political or social change and takes part in activities such as public protests to try to make this happen
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 激進主義分子，行動主義分子;積極分子

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He's been a trade union/party activist for many years.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 多年來他一直是工會／黨的積極分子。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an animal rights activist
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 保護動物權益積極分子

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the situation in which a lot of things are happening or people are moving around

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There was a lot of activity in preparation for the Queen's visit.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 大家都在為準備迎接女王來訪而忙碌。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Economists are concerned by the low level of economic activity.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 經濟學家們都為經濟不景氣而擔憂。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There was a sudden flurry of activity when the director walked in.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 經理一走進來，大家馬上一片手忙腳亂。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the work of a group or organization to achieve an aim

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He was found guilty of terrorist activity.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他因從事恐怖主義活動而被判有罪。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: criminal activities
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 犯罪活動

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: something that is done for enjoyment, especially an organized event

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: His spare-time activities include cooking, tennis, and windsurfing.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他的業餘活動包括烹飪、打網球和風帆運動。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We offer our guests a wide range of outdoor/sporting activities.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們為客人提供一系列廣泛的戶外娛樂／體育活動項目。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a holiday in which you can do a lot of sports and other activities
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （可參加各種運動和其他活動的）運動假期

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: someone who pretends to be someone else while performing in a film, play, or television or radio programme

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "Who's your favourite actor?" "Robert de Niro."
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 「你最喜歡的演員是誰？」「勞勃‧狄尼洛。」

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a female actor

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She's the highest-paid actress in Hollywood.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她是好萊塢片酬最高的女演員。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: existing in fact
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 現實的，實際的；真實的，真正的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We had estimated about 300 visitors, but the actual number was much higher.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們估計大約會有300名來賓，可實際人數要多得多。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The exams are in July, but the actual results (= the results themselves) don't appear until September.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 考試是在七月份，但是真正成績公佈要等到九月份。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: really

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a fact
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 真實情況，實際情況；事實

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He's out of touch with the actualities of life in Africa.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他已經不了解非洲的現狀了。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: really

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to make something that could possibly happen or be achieved really happen or be achieved
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 把…化為行動；發揮出…的潛力

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: the techniques that athletes use to actualize their potential
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 運動員藉以發揮潛力的技巧

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in fact or really

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I didn't actually see her - I just heard her voice.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 實際上我並沒有看見她，只是聽到了她的聲音。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: So what actually happened?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 那麼到底發生了甚麼事呢？

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: used in sentences in which there is information that is in some way surprising or the opposite of what most people would expect
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （表示意外或與通常預期的相反）居然，竟然

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I didn't like him at first, but in the end I actually got quite fond of him.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 起初我對他並沒有好感，可最後我竟然挺喜歡他的。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I'm one of the few people who doesn't actually like champagne.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 少數人還真是不喜歡香檳酒，我就是其中之一。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Don't tell me he actually paid for you!
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 別跟我說他居然替你付了錢！

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: used as a way of making a sentence slightly more polite, for example when you are expressing an opposing opinion, correcting what someone else has said, or refusing an offer
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （用於禮貌地表示反對、糾正他人或拒絕他人提議等）其實，說實話，實際上

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "Alexander looks like he'd be good at sports." "Actually, he's not."
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 「亞歷山大看來很擅長運動。」「事實並非如此。」

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Actually, Gavin, it was Tuesday of last week, not Wednesday.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 實際上呢，加文，那是上星期二，不是星期三。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "Do you mind if I smoke?" "Well, actually, I'd rather you didn't."
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 「我抽支煙你介意嗎？」「嗯，說實話，我希望你還是別抽。」

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: relating to the work of an actuary, or to the job of being an actuary
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 保險精算的;保險精算師的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: These figures are based on actuarial calculations of the risks involved.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這些數字建立在對所涉及風險的精確計算之上。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: actuarial jobs
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 涉及精算的工作

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a person who calculates how likely accidents, such as fire, flood, or loss of property, are to happen, and tells insurance companies how much they should charge their customers
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 保險精算師（計算火災、洪水或財產遺失等事故發生的頻率並以此為依據告知保險公司應向其顧客收取的保險費）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to make a machine work or be the reason a person acts in a certain way

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: A detonator is actuated by heat, percussion, friction, or electricity.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 高溫、撞擊、摩擦或電力均可引爆雷管。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He was actuated almost entirely by altruism.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他幾乎完全是出於無私。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the fact of making a machine start to work or a process start to happen

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: They carried out tests on the actuation of safety features.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他們對安全功能的啟動進行測試。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: part of a machine or system that moves something or makes something work

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: the cruise control actuator
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 巡航車速控制執行器

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The actuators are powered by wires and controlled by three circuits connected to a power supply.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 執行器由電線供電，並由連接到電源的三個電路控制。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the ability to hear, see, or think accurately and clearly
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （聽力、視力、思維等的）靈敏度;敏銳

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Tiredness also affects visual acuity.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 疲勞也會影響視力的靈敏度。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He was a man of great political acuity.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他是一個對政治高度敏感的人。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: skill in making correct decisions and judgments in a particular subject, such as business or politics

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She has considerable business/financial acumen.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她在商業／金融方面相當敏銳。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a treatment for pain or illness in which certain parts of the body are pressed with the hands
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 指壓（一種治療疼痛或其他疾病的方法，以手指按壓身體特定部位）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a treatment for pain or illness in which thin needles are positioned just under the surface of the skin at special points around the body

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Acupuncture originated in China.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 針刺療法起源於中國。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a person who is trained to do acupuncture (= a treatment for pain or illness using thin needles put into the skin in particular places around the body)

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Acupuncture is an extremely safe treatment if done by a certified acupuncturist.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 如果由經過認證的針灸師施針，針灸是一種非常安全的治療方式。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She was managing her asthma with help from an acupuncturist.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 在針灸師的幫助下，她的哮喘得到了控制。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: If a bad situation is acute, it causes severe problems or damage.

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She felt acute embarrassment/anxiety/concern at his behaviour.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她對他的行為感到極其尷尬／憂慮／擔憂。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The problem of poverty is particularly acute in rural areas.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 貧窮問題在農村地區尤為嚴重。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: An acute pain or illness is one that quickly becomes very severe.

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: acute abdominal pains
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 劇烈腹痛

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an acute attack of appendicitis
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 闌尾炎急性發作

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: used to describe intelligence, senses, etc. that are very good, accurate, and able to notice very small differences
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （感官等）敏銳的，靈敏的;機敏的，有洞察力的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: acute eyesight/hearing
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 敏銳的視覺／聽覺

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an acute sense of smell
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 靈敏的嗅覺

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: a woman of acute intelligence/judgment
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 機敏聰穎／有敏銳判斷力的女性

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: An acute angle is less than 90 degrees.
a sign that is written above a letter in some languages, showing you how to pronounce the letter

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There's an acute accent on the e in "café".
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: Café這個詞中字母e上面有個銳音符。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: completely or extremely

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Management is acutely aware of the resentment that their decision may cause.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 管理層非常清楚他們的決定可能會招致憤恨。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Another scandal would be acutely embarrassing for the government.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 如果再出現一次醜聞，政府將陷入極度尷尬之中。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in a very clever or detailed way

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She acutely identified all the main problems.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她敏銳地指出了所有的主要問題。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the quality of being very good, accurate, and showing an ability to notice very small differences
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （感官等）敏銳，靈敏;機敏，有洞察力

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He is remembered for the acuteness of his intellect.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他因其敏銳的才智而被人們銘記。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He was distinguished by the liveliness of his conversation and the acuteness of his understanding.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他的特點是說話生動，悟性敏銳。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the fact of being very serious or severe

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The choice of drug depends upon the severity, acuteness and cause of the pain.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 對藥物的選擇取決於疼痛的嚴重程度、尖銳程度和原因。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: You will have to deal with crises of varying acuteness.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 你將不得不處理不同程度的危機。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: informal for an advertisement

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I often prefer the ads on TV to the actual programmes.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我常常對電視廣告比對節目本身更感興趣。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG:
abbreviation for 
Anno Domini : a Latin phrase meaning "in the year of the Lord", which is used when referring to a year after Jesus Christ was born
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 西元（拉丁語Anno Domini的縮寫）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: in 1215 AD/AD 1215
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 在西元1215年

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: during the seventh century AD
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 在西元七世紀期間

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG:
abbreviation for 
Alzheimer's Disease
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 阿茲海默症，失智症（Alzheimer's的縮寫）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a company that produces advertisements
made or happening only for a particular purpose or need, not planned before it happens
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 特別的，專門的;臨時安排的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an ad hoc committee/meeting
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 特別委員會／會議

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We deal with problems on an ad hoc basis (= as they happen).
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們應對問題的方式是只要出現就隨時解決。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the practice of reacting to what happens or is needed at a particular time, rather than planning in advance
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 採取臨時對策;作出特別決定

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He offers a rigid set of foreign policy principles in sharp contrast to the previous leader's ad hocism.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他提出了一整套精確的對外政策原則，與前領導人慣于採用臨時特別措施的做法形成了鮮明對比。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the practice of reacting to what happens or is needed at a particular time, rather than planning in a way that suits all possible situations
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 採取臨時對策;作出特別決定

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The government cannot continue to get away with ad hockery in response to local transport needs.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 面對當地的交通需求，市政會採取臨時對策的做法不再行得通。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: (of a criticism, etc.) directed against a person, rather than against what that person is saying

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an ad hominem attack on his rival
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 對他對手發動的人身攻擊

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: for ever, without ending

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "Why was she such a lousy boss?" "Oh, because she was unreasonable, disrespectful, rude, inconsiderate - I could go on ad infinitum."
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 「她怎麼是個這麼討厭的老闆呢？」「噢，因為她不可理喻、傲慢無禮、粗魯蠻橫、麻木不仁——你想聽多少我都可以列出來。」

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: said without any preparation or practice

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I'd forgotten the notes for my speech so I had to do it ad lib.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我演講時忘了帶稿，只好即興發揮。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to speak in public without having planned what to say

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She ad-libbed her way through the entire speech.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她整場演講都是即興作出的。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: If someone discusses something ad nauseam, they talk about it so much that it becomes very boring.
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 喋喋不休地，令人厭煩地

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He talks ad nauseam about how clever his children are.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他喋喋不休地說著他的孩子有多聰明，真是令人生厭。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a computer program that prevents advertisements from being displayed on a screen, for example when you visit a website

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Many users have an ad-blocker installed.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 許多使用者都安裝了阻止廣告的軟體。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the use of a computer program to prevent advertisements from being displayed on a screen, for example when you visit a website

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Ad-blocking poses a threat to the revenue of many websites.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 安裝阻止廣告的軟體極大地威脅到很多網站的收益。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: ad-blocking software
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 廣告屏蔽軟體

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a wise saying

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He remembered the old adage "Look before you leap".
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他想起了那句老話「三思而後行」。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a piece of music that should be played slowly

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Barber's Adagio for Strings
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 巴伯的《弦樂慢板》

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a character in the Bible who was the first man made by God
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 亞當（《聖經》中的人物，是上帝創造的第一個人）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the part of your throat that sticks out, especially in men, and moves up and down when you speak or swallow
impossible to persuade, or unwilling to change an opinion or decision
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 固執的；堅決的，堅定不移的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I've told her she should stay at home and rest but she's adamant that she's coming.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我告訴過她應該在家裡休息，可她堅持要來。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: extremely hard

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: a wall of adamantine rock
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 一堵極其堅硬的石牆

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: extremely determined and strong or unwilling to change
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 堅定不移的；頑強不屈的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He bowed to her adamantine will.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他讓步於她頑強不屈的意志。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in a way that means it is impossible to persuade you or make you change your opinion or decision

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The mayor is adamantly opposed to any tax increase.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 市長堅決反對任何增稅提議。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Most people were adamantly against the decision.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 大多數人堅決反對這一決定。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to change something to suit different conditions or uses
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 使適應不同情況（或用途）;改動;改造;改裝;改編

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Many software companies have adapted popular programs to the new operating system.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 許多軟體公司已經改編了常用的程式以適應新的作業系統。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The recipe here is a pork roast adapted from Caroline O'Neill's book "Louisiana Kitchen".
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這道菜是根據卡洛琳•奧尼爾《路易斯安那廚房》一書中烤豬肉的做法改進而來的。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We had to adapt our plans to fit Jack's timetable.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們不得不改變我們的計劃來遷就傑克的時間安排。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The play had been adapted for (= changed to make it suitable for) children.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這個劇本已被改編成兒童劇。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Davies is busy adapting Brinkworth's latest novel for television.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 大衛斯正忙著把布林克沃斯的最新小說改編成電視劇。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to become familiar with a new situation

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The good thing about children is that they adapt very easily to new environments.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 小孩的長處就是能夠很容易地適應新環境。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: It took me a while to adapt to the new job.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我過了一段時間才適應了新工作。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: an ability or willingness to change in order to suit different conditions

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Adaptability is a necessary quality in an ever-changing work environment.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 在不斷變化的工作環境中，適應能力是一種必要的素質。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Overseas experience shows adaptability and an ability to cope with foreign languages.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 海外經驗顯示了適應能力和應對外語的能力。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: able or willing to change in order to suit different conditions
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 有適應能力的，能適應的;適應性強的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The survivors in this life seem to be those who are adaptable to change.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 能在這種生活狀態下倖存的人好像都是那些可以適應變化的人。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the process of changing to suit different conditions

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Evolution occurs as a result of adaptation to new environments.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 進化是生物適應新環境的結果。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a film, book, play, etc. that has been made from another film, book, play, etc.

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Last year he starred in the film adaptation of Bill Cronshaw's best-selling novel.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 去年他主演了那部由比爾‧克朗肖的暢銷小說改編的電影。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: changed slightly for a particular purpose or use
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 改動的;改造的;改裝的;改編的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He drives a specially adapted car.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他開著一輛經過特別改裝的汽車。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The festive grotto is in fact an adapted garden shed.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 節日石窟實際上是一個經過改造的花園棚子。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: (of a living thing) able to exist in a particular environment because of changes that have happened to it over time

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Both trees are well adapted to London's dry climate and dirty air.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這兩棵樹對倫敦的乾燥氣候和骯髒空氣都已經適應了。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The rat is uniquely adapted to living around humans.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 大鼠獨特地適應了在人類周圍生活。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a type of plug that makes it possible to connect two or more pieces of equipment to the same electrical supply
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （供多個設備連接電源的）多頭插頭，多功能插頭

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a device that is used to connect two pieces of equipment
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （電器設備的）轉換插頭，轉接器，適配器

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a person who makes slight changes to a book, play, or other piece of text so that it can be performed
having an ability to change to suit different conditions

a method of education or training using computers, that uses algorithms (= sets of mathematical rules) to change teaching material, exercises, etc. according to the needs and performance of each learner
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 適應性學習（一種使用電腦進行的教學方法，通過演算法得知每個學習者的需求並依此組織教學材料等）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Adaptive learning is very powerful as it allows a custom-made learning experience.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 自適應學習非常強大，因為它可以定製因人而異的學習體驗。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: You should expect to dedicate approximately 7-10 hours a week to watching videos and engaging in adaptive learning exercises.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 你應該計劃每周拿出大約7-10小時來觀看錄影和參與自適應學習練習。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in a way that involves changing to suit changing conditions

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There are health apps that adaptively tweak an exercise regimen to maximize the benefit to each user.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 有一些健康應用程式可以適應地調整鍛煉方案，為每個用戶帶來最大限度地益處。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The organism has a capacity to respond adaptively to environmental challenge and stress.

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 公共醫療的充分性受到了質疑。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There are concerns about the accuracy and adequacy of food labelling.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 人們對食品標籤的準確性和充分性表示擔憂。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: enough or satisfactory for a particular purpose
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 足夠的;合格的;合乎需要的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Have we got adequate food for 20 guests?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們的食物夠招待20位客人嗎？

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I didn't have adequate time to prepare.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我沒有充足的時間來準備。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: It's not a big salary but it's adequate for our needs.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 薪資雖不優厚，但足以滿足我們的需要了。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The council's provision for the elderly is barely adequate (= is not enough).
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 市政會給長者提供的保障不足。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Will future oil supplies be adequate to meet world needs?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 未來的石油供應能滿足世界的需要嗎？

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in a way that is enough or satisfactory for a particular purpose
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 足夠地;合格地;合乎需要地

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: While some patients can be adequately cared for at home, others are best served by care in a hospital.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 雖然有些病人可以在家裡得到充分的照顧，但其他病人最好在醫院接受治療看護。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Manufacturers may lack the means to adequately test their product.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 製造商可能缺乏對產品進行充分測試的手段。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG:
abbreviation for
attention deficit hyperactivity disorder UK
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 注意力不足過動症（attention deficit hyperactivity disorder的縮寫）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to stick firmly

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: A smooth, dry surface helps the tiles adhere to the wall.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 平滑、乾燥的牆面有助於瓷磚黏在牆上。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to continue to obey a rule or have a belief

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She adhered to her principles/ideals throughout her life.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她終生對自己的原則／理想忠貞不渝。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: They failed to adhere to the terms of the agreement/treaty.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他們沒有遵守協議／條約的條款。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The translator has obviously adhered very strictly to the original text.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 顯然，譯者嚴格忠實於原文。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the fact of someone behaving exactly according to rules, beliefs, etc.

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He was noted for his strict adherence to the rules.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他因為嚴守規則而聞名。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: sticky

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an adherent surface
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 黏性表面

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a person who strongly supports a particular person, principle, or set of ideas

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She has long been an adherent of the Communist Party.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 長期以來她一直是共產黨的擁護者。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the ability to stick

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: At this stage a resin is used with a high level of adhesion.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這步工序需要用一種黏合力很強的樹脂。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: glue

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: You'll need a/some strong adhesive to mend that chair.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 你需要用一種／一些強力黏合劑才能修好那把椅子。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: sticky

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: adhesive tape/paper
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 膠帶／膠紙

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: an adiabatic process is one in which there is no heat transfer (= heat does not enter or leave the system)
goodbye

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She bade (= said to) him adieu and left.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她向他告別後離去。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: goodbye
relating to animal fat

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: adipose tissue (= fat)
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 脂肪組織

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: written abbreviation for adjective
the fact of being very near, next to, or touching something

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Another conflict arises from the adjacency of the verb to its subject.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 另一個衝突在於動詞和其主語的連用。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The adjacency of the two components increases the effectiveness of both.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這兩個組件連在一起使兩者的有效性都提高了。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: very near, next to, or touching

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: They work in adjacent buildings.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他們在相鄰的兩座樓裡工作。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: They lived in a house adjacent to the railway.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他們家住在鐵路旁邊。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: one of the two angles on either side of a straight line that divides a larger angle into two
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 鄰角（由角分線將一個大角分成的相鄰兩個小角中的一個）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: containing, being, or relating to an adjective

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an adjectival phrase
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 一個形容詞短語

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Alkaline is the adjectival form of the noun alkali.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 「鹼性的」是名詞「鹼」的形容詞形式。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He hardly ever uses a noun without an adjectival modifier.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他幾乎從不使用沒有形容詞修飾語的名詞。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: as an adjective

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: In "kitchen table", the noun "kitchen" is used adjectivally.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 在「廚房餐桌」這個短語中，「廚房」這個名詞被作為形容詞使用。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Prepositions such as in and out can appear adjectivally, for example "the in thing", "it's out".
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 像「in」和「out」這樣的介詞可以作為形容詞使用，比如在「the in thing（時髦的東西）」和「it‘s out（那不流行了）」裡。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a word that describes a noun or pronoun

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: "Big", "boring", "purple", and "obvious" are all adjectives.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 「大的」、「無聊的」、「紫色的」以及「明顯的」這些詞都是形容詞。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to be very near, next to, or touching

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The stables adjoin the west wing of the house.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 馬廐緊挨著房子的西廂。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: It's at this point that these three neighbourhoods adjoin.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這兒正是這三個街區的交界點。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: near, next to, or touching

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: We asked for adjoining rooms.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們要了相鄰的房間。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to have a pause or rest during a formal meeting or trial

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The meeting was adjourned until Tuesday.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 會議延期至星期二。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Shall we adjourn for lunch?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們暫停先去吃午餐好嗎？

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to finish doing something and go somewhere, usually for a drink and some food

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Shall we adjourn to the sitting room for coffee?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我們到客廳喝杯咖啡好嗎？

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a pause or rest during a formal meeting or trial, or the act of giving a pause or rest

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The defence attorney requested an adjournment.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 辯護律師要求休庭。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The court's adjournment means that a decision will not be reached until December at the earliest.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 休庭意味著最早要到12月才能做出判決。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to announce a decision or consider something, especially officially
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （尤指正式地）判決，宣判，裁決;認為

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Half an hour into the game Paterson was adjudged to have fouled Jackson and was sent off.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 比賽進行到半小時時，派特森被判對傑克遜犯規而被罰離場。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He was adjudged bankrupt by the court.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他被法庭宣判破產。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Fairbanks was adjudged the winner.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 費爾班克斯被判定獲勝。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to act as judge in a competition or argument, or to make a formal decision about something
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 擔任裁判;判決，裁定，裁決

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He was asked to adjudicate on the dispute.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 人們請他來對這場爭端作出裁定。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He was called in to adjudicate a local land dispute.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他被請來裁決一樁當地的土地糾紛。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The game was adjudicated a win for Black.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 布萊克被裁定贏得比賽。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the act of judging a case, competition, or argument, or of making a formal decision about something

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The legality of the transaction is still under adjudication (= being decided) in the courts.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 交易的合法性仍在法庭上有待裁決（=正在決定）。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: His adjudication was later found to be faulty.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他的判決後來被發現是錯誤的。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Adjudication of the competition is the responsibility of the college.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 比賽的評判由學院負責。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a person or group that makes an official decision about something, especially about who is right in a disagreement

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She acted as adjudicator in the dispute.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她擔任了這場爭端的裁定人。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: something added or connected to a larger or more important thing

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I hoped I would find the computer course a useful adjunct to my other studies.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我希望上了這門電腦課程後，會使其他科目的學習如虎添翼。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: In grammar, an adjunct is an adverb or phrase that gives extra information in a sentence.
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 修飾成分（文法中指在句子中提供附加資料的副詞或者副詞片語）

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to ask or order someone to do something

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The judge adjured him to answer truthfully.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 法官要求他如實回答。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to change something slightly, especially to make it more correct, effective, or suitable
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （尤指為了使某物更正確、有效或合適而）調整，調節

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: If the chair is too high you can adjust it to suit you.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 如果椅子太高了，你可以把它調到適合你的高度。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: As a teacher you have to adjust your methods to suit the needs of slower children.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 作為一名老師，你必須調整教學方法來適應那些學得較慢的孩子的需要。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to arrange your clothing to make yourself look tidy

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She adjusted her skirt, took a deep breath, and walked into the room.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她整理了一下裙子，深吸一口氣，走進了房間。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to become more familiar with a new situation

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I can't adjust to living on my own.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我不習慣獨自生活。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Her eyes slowly adjusted to the dark.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她的眼睛慢慢適應了黑暗。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The lifestyle is so very different - it takes a while to adjust.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 生活方式差別太大了，要過一段時間才能適應。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: able to be changed to suit particular needs

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The height of the steering wheel is adjustable.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 方向盤的高度可以調節。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Is the strap on this helmet adjustable?
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這頂頭盔的扣帶可以調節嗎？

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a metal tool with parts that can be moved to tighten or unfasten any size of nut or bolt

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The easiest way to undo and do up nuts is with an adjustable spanner.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 擰松或擰緊螺母最簡單的辦法就是使用活動扳手。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Use an adjustable spanner to turn the valve clockwise.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 使用活動扳手按順時針方向旋動閥門。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a small change

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She made a few minor adjustments to the focus of her camera.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她稍微調了調照相機的焦距。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the ability to become more familiar with a new situation

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He has so far failed to make the adjustment from school to work.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他到現在還沒有適應從學生生活到工作的變化。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a condition in which someone feels sad and hopeless as a result of a stressful event
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 適應障礙（一種情緒障礙，由於壓力事件而產生憂鬱、絕望等情緒）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Many of the symptoms in an adjustment disorder overlap with those of a diagnosis of major depression.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 適應障礙的許多症狀跟重度憂鬱症相似。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a military officer who does office work and who is responsible for rules and punishment among the lower ranks
a substance that strengthens the body's immune response (= ability to fight harmful substances, disease, etc.)
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （加強身體免疫功能的）佐劑，輔藥

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: given after the main treatment for cancer
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （癌症治療過程中，在主要治療手段之後採取的）輔助型的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: All women in the study received adjuvant therapy with tamoxifen.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 參與這項研究的所有女性都接受了採用泰莫西芬的輔助治療。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: abbreviation for activities of daily living: the basic activities that people need to be able to do in order to take care of themselves, for example, getting in and out of bed, getting dressed, and eating
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 日常生活活動（activities of daily living 的縮寫）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: How quickly ADLs are regained after a stroke varies from person to person.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 中風之後重新獲得日常生活活動能力的速度因人而異。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a man who works in advertising
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 廣告人;廣告商;廣告從業人員

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to control the operation or arrangement of something

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The economy has been badly administered by the present government.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 現任政府一直不擅長經濟工作。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to govern a country, region, etc.

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The economy has been badly administered by the present government.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 現任政府一直不擅長經濟工作。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to cause someone to receive something

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: to administer medicine/punishment/relief
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 給藥／施加懲罰／發放救濟品

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Tests will be administered to schoolchildren at seven and twelve years.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 7歲和12歲的學生將接受測試。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The latest opinion polls have administered a severe blow to the party.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 最新的民意調查結果對該黨來說是當頭一棒。

PHARSE-BODY.PHRASE-DEFINITION-ENG: to be present while someone says an oath (= a formal promise) officially

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the arrangements and tasks needed to control the operation of a plan or organization

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Teachers complain that more of their time is taken up with administration than with teaching.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 教師抱怨他們花在行政工作上的時間超過了教學的時間。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She has little experience in admin (= in organizing a business, etc.).
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她沒有甚麼管理經驗。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the people in an organization who manage its business and operations
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （企業、機關等的）管理人員;行政人員;管理部門

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The decision to cancel the trip was made by the school administration.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 取消行程的決定是學校管理部門做出的。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a period of government, or the people who are in government
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 壹屆政府或政府人員（如總統及其內閣）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: the Obama administration/the last Republican administration
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 歐巴馬政府／上屆共和黨政府

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the act of giving someone something

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There are strict controls on the administration of drugs.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 藥品的施用受嚴格管制。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the process that takes place when a company cannot pay its debts and is allowed to make changes to its organization to try to avoid going into liquidation (= when a business is closed and the things it owns are sold)
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 管理令程序，即公司資不抵債時的一種拯救程序，允許公司變更管理人以避免清算。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The company has gone into administration, in order for money to be returned to creditors.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 公司已進入管理令程序，以期將資金返還債權人。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: relating to the arrangements and work that is needed to control the operation of a plan or organization

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: administrative work
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 行政工作

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an administrative problem
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 管理問題

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Your responsibilities will be mainly administrative.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 你的職責主要是在行政方面。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: someone whose job is to do tasks such as arranging meetings, typing letters, etc. for someone
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 行政助理（為某人安排會議、錄入信件等）

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: He works as an administrative assistant in a financial services organization.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他在一家金融服務機構擔任行政助理。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a period of time when an employee does not have to go to work for a particular reason
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （因為某種特定原因，雇員無須上班的）行政休假

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Managers and supervisors are authorized to approve paid administrative leave for individuals in their areas who were affected by the fire.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 經理和管理人有權批准自己單位受火災影響人員休帶薪行政假。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: relating to the arrangements and work that is needed to control the operation of a plan or organization

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The six hospitals are administratively separate from the university.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這六家醫院在行政上是與大學分開的。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I want to establish an administratively stable organization.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我想建立一個行政上穩定的組織。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: someone whose job is to control the operation of a business, organization, or plan

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: From 1969 to 1971, he was administrator of the Illinois state drug abuse program.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 從1969年到1971年間，他主持伊利諾州禁毒計劃。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She works as a school administrator.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她是學校的一名行政人員。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: deserving respect or approval
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 可欽佩的;值得羨慕的;令人讚賞的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I think you showed admirable tact/restraint/self-control in your answer.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我認為你在回答問題時表現出的機敏／克制／自控令人敬佩。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The police did an admirable job in keeping the fans calm.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 警方在控制球迷的激動情緒方面表現可嘉。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: very well, or in a way that is admirable (= deserving respect or approval)
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 絕妙地，極好地，可欽佩地

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: I think she coped admirably with a very difficult situation.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 我認爲她出色地應對了非常困難的情況。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: As a set of instructions, it is admirably concise.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 作爲說明，它非常簡潔。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: an officer of very high rank in the navy
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: 海軍將軍;海軍上將;艦隊司令

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Admiral Nelson/Horatio Nelson
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 海軍上將納爾遜/霍雷肖·納爾遜

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Yes, Admiral.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 「是的，將軍。」

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the branch of law that deals with ships and shipping (= transporting things or people by sea)

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: There are specialized rules in admiralty with regard to attacks on ferries and cruise ships.

a hormone produced by the body, for example when you are frightened, angry, or excited, that makes the heart beat faster and prepares the body to react to danger

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: If a boat is adrift, it is moving on the water but is not controlled by anyone because of a problem.

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to cause a substance, usually a gas, to form a very thin layer on the surface of another substance

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 漂白土是一種有高度吸附力的類似粘土的物質。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a material that causes a substance, usually a gas, to form a very thin layer on its surface

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 空氣動力學原理

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: an aerodynamic design/car
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 流線型設計／轎車

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: in a way that relates to how well something is able to move through air

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: aerodynamically designed/efficient
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 根據空氣動力學設計的/空氣動力上高效的

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: In a wind turbine, wind goes past an aerodynamically shaped blade that turns a generator, producing power.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 在風力渦輪機中，風經過一個按空氣動力學原理成型的葉片，該葉片轉動發電機，產生電力。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the science that studies the movement of gases and the way solid bodies, such as aircraft, move through them
a solid material that is synthetic (= artificial, not found in nature), that has a very low density (= mass relative to its size), and that is made by replacing the liquid in a gel with a gas

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: When solidified, aerogels make good insulation for a spacecraft or aircraft.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 凝固後，氣凝膠可以為航天器或飛機提供良好的隔熱效果。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Jackets lined with aerogel can keep you warm in temperatures of 50 below zero.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 以氣凝膠做內襯的夾克可以在零下50度的溫度裏保暖。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG:
an 
air letter
someone who travels in a flying vehicle such as a hot-air balloon or airship

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: This was the first time an aeronaut had crossed the Pacific Ocean alone in an air balloon.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這是飛翔員第一次獨自駕駛氣球飛越太平洋。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: relating to the science of designing, building, and operating aircraft

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: aeronautic design/engineering
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 航空設計/工程

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: They want to hire an aeronautic engineer who can also programme the computer.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 他們想聘請一位懂計算機編程的航空工程師。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: relating to the science of designing, building, and operating aircraft

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: aeronautical engineering/science
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 航空工程/科學

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Aeronautical charts are not available to view online but you can buy them.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 無法在線查看航圖，但可供購買。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: the science of designing, building, and operating aircraft
the fear of travelling in an aircraft
POS-BODY.DEFINITION-CHI: （懼怕乘坐飛機的）高空恐怖症

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: (in some diseases) the fear of the movement of air

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Hydrophobia and aerophobia occur in 50 percent of rabies patients.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 狂犬病人中有50%會出現恐水症和氣流恐怖症的情況。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: any musical instrument in which sound is produced mainly by the vibration (= continuous quick movement) of air

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The category of aerophones includes wind instruments, accordions, and whirly tubes.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 管樂器包括吹奏樂器、手風琴和音鳴管等。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: a vehicle designed for air travel that has wings and one or more engines

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: She has her own private aeroplane.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 她擁有私人飛機。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG:
→ 
airplane mode
a metal container in which liquids are kept under pressure and forced out in a spray
a mixture of particles (= extremely small pieces of matter) and the liquid or gas that they are contained in

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Aerosols are a subset of air pollution that refers to the tiny particles suspended everywhere in our atmosphere.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 氣溶膠是空氣污染的一部分，指在大氣中無所不在的微小顆粒。

POS-BODY.DEFINITION-ENG: to turn or be turned into an aerosol (= a mixture of extremely small pieces of matter and the liquid or gas that they are contained in, that can spread through the air)

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: Evidence suggests that the coronavirus can aerosolize only under very limited conditions.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 證據顯示冠狀病毒只有在非常有限的條件下才會成為氣溶膠。

EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT: The study suggests the virus is aerosolized through talking and exhalation.
EXAMPLE-SENTS.SENT-CHT: 這一研究提示病毒在交談和呼氣過程中成為氣溶膠。
